ami: I loma' to haw ci vayi?
Awaay, makatahkal cira, o lavii to a taloma'.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

ami: I loma' to haw ci vaki?
Ira to cira i sakatosa a tatongrohan, katakodol isaw!
english: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

ami: Ci Kacaw haw, matenes to a caay pakamelaw itisowan, mamaan to saw kiso?
english: It’s Kacaw. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

ami: Kapah to isaw! o tayniayay kako a masasowasowal itisowan.
english: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

ami: Ira i aniva cira a misacacak, angangen ako cira.
english: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

ami: Tayra i parovoan cira a mireper to ayam.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

ami: Awaay i loma' ci vaki namo, ira i omah cira, ka i loma' han to a mitala to nikataloma' nira.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

ami: Matenes to a caay pakamelaw, mavatacay to kiso.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

ami: Lipahak ko valoco' to nikatayni no miso.
english: It’s so good to see you.

ami: U sapaveli itamowan kina paringad, pateli han to i pinsiyang.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

ami: Matenesay to a caay katayni, angangngaw no mako ko heni a makomod kita a malavi.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

ami: Hamanan aca, kaw ociya han to, ini to kita i palavangan a masasowasowal.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

ami: A taloma' to kako haw, aray.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

ami: Makahnipacokan kina ayam, o sapataloma' no miso kiniyan.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

ami: A malalitemoh haw kita anocila i herek no lahok?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

ami: Hayi, icowa saw kita a malalitemoh?
Idengay haw kita i cacodadan a malalitemoh? A miloing kita.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

ami: Kanca tayra i taloan kita, a silosid to kako.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

ami: Savangcal saan a macerak ko sakola i niyaro' niyam. I kacerakan no varo iri, tayni han to haw!
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

ami: Tala han to to nikacanglahan, a maotang to!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

ami: I tiya han to i nikalalikidan a tayni isaw!
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!

ami: Hayi, tala han to no mako.
english: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

ami: Kiya mangalay kiso a taloma' i niyaro'?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

ami: A taloma' kako itila a pasevana' to micodaday.
english: I want to return to teach at the local school.

ami: Kiya caay ka itila i tokay a pasevana' to micodaday?
english: Why not teach in the city?

ami: Maoron to kako to tadaniyaro' no mako, mangalay kako a pananokas to niyaro'.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

ami: U mavana':ay kiso a mitenon, nacima saw ko pasevana'ay itisowan?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

ami: Ci vayi no mako, o savana'ay a mitenon no niyaro' cira.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

ami: Kiya mangalay kiso a minanam a mitenon?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

ami: U no mita a serangawan ko mitenon hananay, hangay, madotoc to ko serangawan no mita sa kako.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

ami: U mavana'ay kiso haw! A matenes haw a misaepah?
english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

ami: Caay to, cacay a lalipayan, kiya madengaay to. A o panay ato velac ko sapisahemay, tiya palamlam han to to tamod a mikiwakiw, ta, pinaro han to i koreng.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

ami: U maan saw ko pacakayen no miso?
Ira ko copel, lokiw, o nipalomaan no mako amin!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

ami: Pinaay saw ko aca no tosaay a nipicakay?
Tosa a patekenan ira ko lima a polo' ko aca amin.
Maolah kako tina vodoyan, pinaan saw ko aca?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

ami: Lima a patekenan ko aca no niyan.
Tadamatekes, serepen atodi ko aca isaw?
english: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

ami: Akaa, ano serepen aca ko aca a masipon kako.
english: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

ami: Hayi ! kaw iraan aca o mohtingay a vodoy ko kangalayan no mako.
english: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

ami: A micakay kako tina hawan ato sisoy.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

ami: Tosa a malevot ko aca amin, o nakamayan no mako kinian, a matenes a ca:ay kapeci'.
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

ami: Pasevana' han to no mako ko cavay a itini micakay, serepen aca haw ko aca?
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

ami: Hayi, a ira to ko niserep to aca itisowan.
english: Alright! I will give you a discount.

ami: Katayni itini haw! ira ko nipacakayan to vodoy, teper.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

ami: Pinaan saw ko aca nina vodoy?
Tolo a patekenan ira ko lima a polo' ko aca no vodoy to cacay, cacay a malevot ko aca no vadoy to tolo.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

ami: Cacayen aca, ka o vaelohay ko nipaveli itakowan.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

ami: Matatar, mangalay kako a micakay to hakhak ato nisengeran to tawyo a titi.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

ami: Maminay to ko hemay. Ira hen ko nipalamlam to tana' a cong-yo-pin, mangalay haw kiso?.
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

ami: Hayi, cacayen ko no mako, licaaw to a tayni aca kako micakay to hemay.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

ami: Hayi, tavoay to no mako, lima a polo' ko aca no niyan.
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

ami: Nga'ayho, pasifana' ko singsi titaanan to kakaenen no 'Amis.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say Ami for food.

ami: Mahapinang iso ko nisowalan no singsi haw?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

ami: Singsi, caay ka hapinang ako, liyawen haca a somowal.
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

ami: Caay ka tengil ako, nga'ay ta'angayen ko ngiha' haw?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

ami: Pinengneng itini! Tooren kako a misa'osi.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

ami: Liyawenho a misa'osi, sa ta'angayen ko ngiha'.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my eraser.

ami: Caliwen kono tihi iso a sasipasip.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

ami: Nga'ay a pacaliwenho kako to sapisipasip haw?
Tahini aca ko pitilid ita, liyaw sato a lipay a masaso'araw kita.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

ami: O wawa ni Laway kako, ci Caki kako.
english: I am the son of Layay, my name is Caki.

ami: O mitiliday ni Mayaw kako, ci Kacaw kako.
english: I'm a student in Mayaw, my name is Kacaw.

ami: Cima ko ngangan no mama iso?
Ci Lamlo ko ngangan no mama ako.
O kaka ako cingra, ci Maysang cingra.
english: He's my brother, his name is Maysang.

ami: Ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra haw?
Hai, ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra.
Ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra haw?
Caay, ci Kolas ko ngangan ningra.
Ci Panay cingra, o fai ako.
O widang ako cingra, ci Imoy ko ngangan ningra.
english: She's my friend, her name is Imoy.

ami: Mo^tep ira ko tosa ko mihecaan ningra anini.
Hakowaay to ko mihecaan no mama iso anini?

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

ami: Ira ko tatosa a kaka ako, cecay ko safa ako.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?

ami: O maan ko tayal no faki iso?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?
Does your sister have a job?

ami: O malikakaay cangra a tatosa haw?
Hai, 'akawang ko paro no loma' niyam.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.
Does your sister go to school?

ami: Mafana' tono Pangcah a sowal ko safa iso?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

ami: Hai, mafana' cangra a sano Pangcah.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

ami: Malacecay ko aro' iso to mama ato ina haw?
english: Do you live with your parents?

ami: Hai, malacecay ko aro' ako to mama ato ina.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

ami: Malacecay ko aro' iso to akong ato mamo haw?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

ami: Caay, caay ka lacecay ko aro' ako i cangraan.
english: No, I didn’t live with them.

ami: Cima ko cafay iso a maro'?
Malacecay ko aro' ako to mama, ina ato kaka .
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

ami: O nani cowaay kiso a tayni?
Ano hacowa a minokay kiso a talaniyaro'?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

ami: Minokay kako to kaciferangan a pahanhanan.
english: I will go back in the summer.

ami: Masadakayto ko cidal, fa^det ko romi'ad.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It’s cold, so wear more clothes.

ami: Caay ka si^naw, caay ka fa^det, sanga'ay saan.
english: It’s neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

ami: Awaay ko to^em i kakarayan, masadakay ko fo'is.
english: There were no clouds in the sky, the stars came out.

ami: Terp saho ko 'orad, masadakto ko cidal, madasak ko talakal ni Idek.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What’s the weather like where you are?

ami: Tata'ang ko pifiyok no fali i tamiyanan.
english: We’re going to have a big storm here.

ami: Manga'ayay, tata'ang ko sadak no cidal.
english: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

ami: Si^naw ko romi'ad, tongalen ko kaciriko'.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

ami: Ma'orad ano sawni, hawikiden ko saong iso.
english: It’s going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

ami: Makakeleng i sawni, o mama'orad anosawni.
english: There was thunder just now, and it’s supposed to rain later.
It just rained, and now it’s stopped.
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

ami: Ma'oraday haw? Mana macepa' ko tireng iso?
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

ami: Ma'orad ko papotal, caay pihawikid kako to saong.
english: It’s raining outside, so I didn’t bring an umbrella.

ami: Tata'ang ko fali, adada ko fongoh ako.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

ami: Tata'ang ko cidal, malileng ko fongoh ako.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

ami: caay ka pihawikid kako, tata mi'aca kita.
english: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.
Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

ami: Nga'ayto, micakay haca kako to sasipasip.
english: Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I’ve already eaten at home.

ami: Matawal ako a mifa^det ko tafo.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

ami: Matawal ako ko a mihawikid ko tafo.
english: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

ami: Lacecay sa kita a komaen to tafo ako.
english: Then let’s eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?

ami: Komaen kako tono pitilidan a sakalahok.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.

ami: O maan ko kakaenen iso to kalahokan?
english: What are you having for lunch?

ami: Mihawikid kako to tafo anini, lacecay sa kita a malahok.
english: I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!
Let’s go play basketball, shall we?

ami: Padangen kako a miala to saasik.
english: Please help me with the broom.

ami: Hai, pafelien ako kiso tona saasik.
english: Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.

ami: Patadoen kako a miala to sasifin.
english: Can you help me with the cloth?

ami: Miasiaky kako, papialaen iso ci Kacaw.
english: I’m sweeping the floor and you asked Kacaw to carry it for you.
The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

ami: Akaho, caayho ka asik ako itini.
english: Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.
I’m going to see my teacher.
What do you do after school?
I’m going to sing with my friends.

ami: Iraay ci Aso i loma' haw?
english: May I ask if Aso is home?

ami: Iraay i loma' cingra, ka picomod.
english: She’s at home, please come in.
May I ask if Hana is home?

ami: Awaay cingra, o maan ko salicay no miso saw?
english: She’s not here, what can I do for you?

ami: Akong, ci Sonay kako, fohatenho ko fawahan.
english: Grandpa, this is Sonay, please open the door.

ami: Kacaw, ci Mayaw kako, tayni kako i tisowanan a misalama.
english: Kacaw, I’m Mayaw, I’ve come to play with you.

ami: Hai, tada ma'ilol tisowanan, katayni a miholol.
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

ami: Wata! manga'ay a nanomen ko ociya namo.
Kakomaen kita to heci no losay.
Hai, mato nga'ayay kona heci no losay.
Nga'ay a kaenen ko heci no losay haw?
Hai, so'lin a nga'ay a kaenen.
Maherekto misakalafi ci ina, katayni a komen.
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

ami: Halikaenen, o tao kiso a mimaan.
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.
I ate a lot, I’m full.

ami: Adihayen ko nikaenan, aka ka ngodo.
Miliyasto kako, liyaw tayni sato kako a miliso' tisowan.
english: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

ami: Hai, cilimaw tayni i loma' ako a misalama.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

ami: Nga'ayho kita mapolong, keriden no singsi kita anini a miliso' to kalas no niyaro'.
english: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.
Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

ami: Mafana' kamo tono 'Amis a caciyaw. A! tadamanga'ay.
Nga'ayho kita mapolong, keriden no singsi kita anini a tayra i pisalamloan a omah.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

ami: Pisarayarayto kita, haratengen ko hahawikiden a sakatayal.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

ami: Hai, singsi, matatoyto niyam ko sakatayal.
english: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

ami: Nga'ayho kita mapolong, tayra kita i pa^coan anini.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

ami: Misarayaray kita, mami'aca kita to paya.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

ami: O pa'ayaman koni ka'ayaway, o pa'onelan kona 'aikoray, paytemek han ita a minengen.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

ami: Mamaan aca, ka pinengen kiso to 'ayam.
english: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

ami: I ikor no cecay a tatokian i, patikor kita a masa'opo.
english: We’ll be back in an hour.

ami: O maan ko ma'araw iso anini ?
Ma'araw ako ko adihayaya a 'onel, iraho ko adihayay a 'ayam.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

ami: Talaen kako, rarima ko wa'ay ako.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

ami: Talolong ko nanom itira, itini to kita a midangoy.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

ami: O maan ko saka tayni iso?
Maanen iso a tayra i kiwkay?
english: How do you go to church?

ami: Padakawen no mama to tosiya kako a malacecay a tayra.
Maanen ningra a tala pitilidan to hatiniay?
english: How does he usually go to school?

ami: Midakaw cingra to ciyon a tayra pitilidan.
english: He took the subway to school.

ami: Maanen no mamo iso a micakay to dateng?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

ami: Pakaotopay cingra a micakay to dateng.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

ami: Maanen iso a tayra i Fotod?
english: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

ami: Pakatamina kako a tayra i Fotod.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

ami: Pakamaan cingra a tayra i Fotod?
english: How did he get to Orchid Island?

ami: Pakahikoki cingra a tayra i Fotod.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

ami: O maan ko midakawan ningra a tayra i Takaw?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

ami: Pakakawtiy cingra a tayra i Takaw.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

ami: Pakacinamalay cingra a tayra i Posong haw?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

ami: Hai, pakacinamalay cingra a tayra i Posong.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

ami: Pakacinamalay cingra a tayra i Posong haw?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

ami: Caay, pakahikoki cingra a tayra i Posong.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

ami: I ngata noni, iraay ko pidakawan to paso a siyataw haw?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

ami: Iraay, tala'ayaw han ko rakat, ma'arawto ko saytaw no paso.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

ami: Icowaay ko sangataay a siyataw no ciyon itini?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

ami: Awaay ko siyataw no ciyon itini, deng pipakahayya iso.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

ami: Midakaw to paso, hakowa ko halafin tahira i pitilidan?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

ami: Safaw lima a fen tahira to i pitilidan.
Pakakawtiy hakowa ko halafin tahira to i Tayciw?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

ami: Cecay a tatokian tahira to i Tayciw.
english: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

ami: Pakapaliding hakowa ko halafin a tahira i Olay?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

ami: Pakaciyon kiso a tayni i loma' ako, hakowa ko halafin?
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

ami: Pakaala to tosa polo' a fen.

english: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

ami: Iraay ko cecay a otopay ako.
Manga'ay kako a milicay tisowan haw?
Manga'ay kako a milicay tisowan haw?
Na'ay, caay kahakowa ko kafana'an ako.
english: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

ami: Cilimaw kiso to herek no lahok haw? manga'ay a liso'en ako kiso?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

ami: Nga'ayto, talaen ako kiso i loma'.
english: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

ami: Cilimaw kiso ano papacem haw? Sapilicayan kako to pakayniay tono to'asan a kitoh no 'Amis.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the Amis.

ami: Talalotok kako anopapacem, awa kako i loma'.
english: I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

ami: Mafana' kiso to pinangan no rayray no 'Amis, saan ko katengilan ako, saka sapilicayan kako i tisowananan.
english: I heard that you know a lot about Amis traditions and customs, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

ami: Caay ka hakowa ko kafana'an ako, kawrira paca'of han ako ko licay iso.
english: I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

ami: Manga'ay kako a misasing to dademakay a sasing haw? O saka narikayaw a pakaharateng to ikor.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

ami: Siwaayto a polo' ira ko falo ko mihecaan ako.

english: I’m from [Matthew’s Saddle]. *Please change [Matthew Saddle] to an ethnic location.

ami: Mafana' kiso a caciyaw to romaroma a sowal haw?
Mafana' kako a somowal to no 'Amis ato no Piyoma.
english: I can speak Ami and Puyuma.

ami: Malipahak ko faloco' a miliso' i tisowan, o maan ko kapaysinan no mi'adopay?
english: It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

ami: Nga'ay to, yo kapahho kako, mararid kako a talalotok a mi'adop.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

ami: Aray tisowanan, tadamanga'ay ko pipakafana' iso anini a romi'ad.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

ami: Sahto o so'linay koni sowalan ako, mahaen ko kitoh no tato'asan.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

ami: Tahini ko kalaholol ita, tadamiahowid to pipalada' iso.
english: That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

ami: Aka ka ngodo, liyaw sato a malaholol haca kita.
Miliyasto kako, nanay miliyaw a pakatengilho to adihayay a kitoh.
english: I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what do you want to buy?

ami: Mi'aca kako to cecay a ko^epo.
english: I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what are you looking for?

ami: Mi'aca kako to cecay a kafong.
english: I want to buy a hat.

ami: Mi'aca kako to ko^epo, mipacakayay kamo haw?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?

ami: Caay, caay ka pa'aca kami to 'icep.
english: No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?

ami: Pafelien kako to tolo a lofoc.

english: I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

ami: Mi'aca kako to tosa talid a simal.
english: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

ami: Deng cecay to a talid kami.
english: We only have one bottle left.

ami: Padangenho kako a mi'aca to fita'ol.

english: How many pounds do you want to buy?

ami: Pina a tingting ko 'acaen iso a fita'ol?
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

ami: Mi'aca kako to tosa lolong a kenaw.
english: I want to buy two green onions.

ami: Toloayto a lolong itini, ^min hanto a pafeli kiso.
english: There are three left, you can have them all!

ami: Pina ko 'aca no cecay lofoc a felac?
english: How much is this bag of rice?

ami: Tosa so'ot a limood ko cecay lofoc.
Polong i tosapolo' ira ko cecay, tosa aca a polo' nga'ayto.
Siwa a polo' ira ko lima a limood koni.
Mi'acaho kako to miming, ta matatodong somo'ot a limood.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

ami: polong i lima so'ot ira ko mo^tep a limood.
Limaen aca a so'ot, nga'ay haw?

english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?
No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

ami: Tolo polo' limood konini a sinpi, o romaho a maan ko 'a'a caen iso?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

ami: Manga'ay kako a micaliw to payso iso haw?
english: Can I borrow money from you?

ami: Nga'ayto, pina ko caliwen iso saw?
english: Yes! How much do you need?

ami: Matawal ako a mihawikid ko payso, nga'ay a pacaliw to payso iso haw?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

ami: Caay ka pihawikid kako to payso.
english: I don't have any money either!

ami: Matawal ako a mihawikid ko payso, nga'ay a pacaliw to payso iso haw?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

ami: Na'ay, caayho ka patikor kiso toya i 'ayaway a payso.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

ami: Manga'ay kako a micaliw to riko' iso haw?
Manga'ay kako a micaliw to codad iso haw?
Manga'ay a pacaliwen kako to koliciw iso haw?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

ami: Nga'ay to, kawrira patikoren kako anopapacem.
english: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

ami: Ma'oradto, capihawikid kako to saong, nga'ay a pacaliw takowan to saong haw?
english: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

ami: Cecay ko saong ako, lacecay sa kita a misasaong.
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

ami: Oya mipacaliwan iso i'ayaw i takowan a codad koni, patikoren ako kiso.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

ami: O maanho ko nanengnengen iso a codad, pasowal han kako.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

ami: Ano hacowa a patikoren ako kiso to payso saw?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

ami: Mimaan saw, ira sato ko payso iso, itiya hanto.
english: It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

ami: Ano hacowa a patikor kiso to payso i takowan saw?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

ami: Ano hacowa a patikor kiso to codad i takowan saw?
english: When are you going to return my book?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

ami: O nipacaliwan ni Kacaw i tisowanan a impic koninian haw?
english: Did Kacaw lend you this pen?

ami: Hai, o micaliwan ako anini i cingraan.
english: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

ami: O nicaliwan iso ci Kacawan a impic koninian haw?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Kacaw?

ami: Caay, o mi'acan no ina ako konini.
english: No, this is what mom bought.

ami: Awaayto ko cinah, picaliw to cinah ci Panayan.
english: We're out of salt, go borrow some from Panay.

ami: Papipatikoren itakowanan to payso ci Panay.
english: Go tell Panay to pay me back.

ami: Pina ko tadah ningra i tisowanan saw?
english: How much does she owe you?

ami: Tayra kako i palafalan a paloma to dateng.
english: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

ami: Adihay ko rengos, mifariw kako, micefos kako anosawni.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

ami: Nga'ay a pataynien takowanan ko kawkaw ato pitaw haw?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

ami: Mafelihayto ako isawni, o mamifolsak kako anosawni.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

ami: Ma^dengayto a lodoten ko dateng iso haw?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

ami: Nga'ayto a lodoten ko tamana, caayho ka nga'ay a lodoteng ko hedot.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

ami: Wa! Adihay ko malongaday iso a konga.
english: (sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

ami: Nga'ay a mipadang takowan a pateli i 'alili haw?
english: Will you help me with the barn?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.
The fish basket has been full of fish.

ami: Samaan ko pifoting iso to hatiniay?
english: How do you usually catch fish?

ami: O capa' ko sapitesek ako to foting.
english: I shoot fish with a spear.

ami: Mafana' kiso a mipana' to a'adopen?
english: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

ami: O talakal ko sapi'adop ako, roma i mitatoy kako to kowang, ira ko waco a mi'adop.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

ami: O narakatan no fafoy konini a lalan.
english: This is the road the boar took.

ami: O saripa' no fafoy konini, saka o rarakaten no fafoy koni a lalan.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

ami: Tata nengeng ita ko tekel ita, matiya ci tama'ayto.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

ami: Mato masanekay no waco, tata kalamkamen ita a mitoor.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

ami: O maan ko nisanga'an iso imatini?
O mipaekelan to fakloh a talakal konini, o sapilepet to molafaw.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

ami: O maan ko nitelian iso itira?
english: What is that thing you put there?

ami: O cisafaloday to o'o a talakal, o sapitalakal niyam to mancel .
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

ami: Tada miaray to palemed no to'as, adihay ko tama' niyam anini a romi'ad.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

ami: Hai, panokayen ita konini to sapalada' to niyaro'.
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

ami: Pakafana'en no singsi kamo to ngangan no pinanowang anini.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Pangcah language today.

ami: Pakafana'en no singsi kamo to ngangan no pinalengaw anini.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of plants in Pangcah language today.

ami: Pakafana'en no singsi kamo to ngangan no heci no losay anini.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Pangcah language today.

ami: O riko' ni Tomon kora haw?
Cowa, o riko' ni Panay koni.
Singsi, cowa kaala ako ko tilid.
english: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

ami: Lacafay sa to katihiay a kapot minengneng.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

ami: Pacaliwen no mako kiso to sasipasip ako.
english: I will lend you my eraser.

ami: Pahanhan to kita mitilid, tayoen ko rakat a minokay!
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

ami: Nga'ay ho kita, ci Kanas ko ngangan ako.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Kanas.

ami: Nga'ay ho kita a maemin! Ci Kolas ko ngangan ako.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Kolas.

ami: Mayaw, nga'ay ho! Ci Calaw kako.
Sinto, nga'ay ho! Ci Anay kako.
O ina ni Talo kako, ci Dakoc ko ngangan no mako.
O safa ni Talo kako, ci Arik ko ngangan no mako.
english: I am Isin’s sister. My name is Aing.

ami: O singsi ako cira, ci Takaki cira.
O kaka ako cira, ci Ngayaw ko ngangan nira.
Cima ko ngangan no kaka iso to fafahiyan?
english: What is your elder sister’s name?

ami: Ci Hongay ko ngangan no kaka ako to fafahiyan.
english: My elder sister’s name is Hongay.

ami: Cima ko ngangan no safa iso to fafahiyan?
english: What is your younger sister’s name?

ami: Ci Miko ko ngangan no safa ako to fafahiyan.
english: My younger sister’s name is Miko.

ami: Mafana'ay kiso to ngangan nira haw?
Pina to ko mihecaan no kaka iso to fa'inayan anini?
english: How old is your elder brother?

ami: Moetep ira ko lima ko mihecaan nira anini.
Pina to ko mihecaan no safa iso to fa'inayan anini?
english: How old is your younger brother?

ami: Lima to ko mihecaan nira anini.
Iraay ko kongkoan i niyaro' namo haw?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

ami: Itiraay kiso i kongkoan no niyaro' a mitilid haw?
english: Do you study in your tribe’s school?

ami: Hai, malecad to loma'ay ko pitilid i kongkoan.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

ami: O fafahiyan a kaka ako cira.
O fa'inayan a safa ako cira.
O mimaanay ko tayal no ina iso?
O mimaanay ko tayal no ama iso?
Cowa, o idang no safa ako cira.
english: No, he is my younger brother’s friend.
No, she is my younger sister.

ami: Papinaay ko paro no loma' nangra?
english: How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.

ami: Papinaay ko wawa no loma' namo?
english: How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

ami: Tatoloay ko safa ako, saheto o fafahiyan.
english: I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?\nI don’t have any older siblings.
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?
Yes, he is my brother.Are you brothers?

ami: Sienaway ko romi'ad, adihayen ko ninanoman to faedetay a nanom.
english: It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

ami: Faedetay ko romi'ad, adihayen ko ninanoman a nanom.
english: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

ami: Ta'angay ko cidal, aka ca pikilidong.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.
There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

ami: Cowa ko mamacidal anocila, mato'emay ta'angayay ko fali.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

ami: Sienaway ko romi'ad, kacikafang a masadak.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

ami: Nga'ay ko romi'ad toya romi'ad, cowa ko mama'orad.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?

ami: Hai, o mama'orad ko romi'ad toya romi'ad.
english: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

ami: Tomerepay ko 'orad, mahadakay to ko cidal.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.
It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

ami: Cowa ka'orad no hatini, mama'orad i ikor no lahok, sidinay to ano mahadak.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

ami: Wa sienaw haw i kasienawan no lalomihecaan?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

ami: Hai, wa sienaw i kasienawan no lalomihecaan, adihayen ko nicaedongan a riko'.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

ami: Anini a mihecaan wa faedet i laloodan haw?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

ami: Hai, wa faedet i laloodan, adihayen ko ninanoman.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

ami: Maolahay kako to kacanglahan, dihekoay ko romi'ad.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

ami: Cowa kaolah kako to kafalawfawan, adihayay ko faliyos i kafalawfawan.
english: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

ami: Matawalay ako a miala ko tilid.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.

ami: Matawalay ako a miala ko sasipasip.
english: I forgot to bring the eraser.

ami: Matawalay iso a miala ko impic?
english: Do you forget to bring your pen?

ami: Hai, pacaliwen ho kako to impic iso makena?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

ami: O maan ko kakaenen iso a sakalahok?
english: What would you like for lunch?

ami: O maan ko kakaenen iso a sakalafi?
english: What would you like for dinner?

ami: O maan ko nikaenan iso a sakaranam?
english: What did you have for breakfast?

ami: O maan ko nikaenan iso a sakalahok?
english: What did you have for lunch?

ami: 'Ayaw to kiso, sawni to kako tayra mikilim tisowanan.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

ami: Aka ho, micolo' ho kita to tilid.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

ami: Misolacay to kiso to wadis haw?
Cowa ho, mifanaway ho kako to kaysing no hatini.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

ami: Mioraoray to kiso to ngoyos haw?
english: Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

ami: Mifanaway to kiso to kaysing haw?
Maharekay to kako a mifanaw to kaysing.
Mana ca pisawsaw kiso to kamay?
english: Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.
What are you going to do after school?
What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

ami: Hongay, iraay kiso i loma' haw?
Hongay, iraay kiso i loma' haw?
Awaay i loma' ci Hongay! Ci Dakoc kako, mimaan saw? Minokay to ci Hongay, sowal han to ako.
english: Hongay is not at home. I am Dakoc. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

ami: Fofo, ci Hongay aci Dakoc kami, fawahen ho ko loma'!
english: Grandma, we are Hongay and Dakoc, please open the door for us.

ami: Ci Kolas kako, mikilimay kako ci Taloan.
english: I am Kolas, I am here for Talo.

ami: Fofo, tayniay to kako miliso' tisowanan.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

ami: Wata kahalafin to ca ka tayni kiso, ma'ilol to kako tisowanan.
english: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

ami: Hongay, tayniay to kako, misalama kita.
english: Hongay, I am here to play with you.

ami: Micomod, halafin to ko pitala no mako tisowanan.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

ami: O nipalomaan ako a konga koni, tanamen a komaen!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

ami: Sakoesan sa a kaenen kona konga.
english: The sweet potato is so sweet.

ami: Katayni ho! O nipalomaan ako a losay koni, tanamen a komaen.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

ami: Sakoesan sa a kaenen kona losay.
Kamaro' ho! O nipalomaan ako a 'ariray koni to cowa kasiwtoken, tanamen a komaen!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

ami: Ca kanga'ay kako komaen to 'asiro, o lingko sa ko kaenen no mako.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

ami: Podacen no mako ko losay to hakakaenen no miso.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.
Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

ami: Adihayen ko nikaenan, adihay ko nisafelan ako a dateng.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

ami: Adihayen ko nikaenan, adihayay ho ini.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.

ami: Adihayen ko nikaenan, adihayay ho ini.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

ami: Adihayay to ko nikaenan no mako, ca to kanga'ay a komaen.
english: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

ami: Kakeriden no singsi kamo a tayra i lotok anini.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

ami: Adihayay ko likes i lotok saan ci ina.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

ami: Kakeriden no singsi kamo a tayra i omah anini.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

ami: Kakeriden no singsi kita tayra i 'alo.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

ami: Kakeriden no singsi kita a tayra i lotok.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

ami: Cowa, kakeliden no singsi kita tayra i tokos.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

ami: Tatayra kita i tokos anini haw?
english: Are we going to the mountains today?

ami: Cowa, tatayra kita i omah anini.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

ami: Singsi, o maan ko nanengnengen no mita i 'alo?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

ami: Singsi, o maan ko nanengnengen no mita i tokos?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.

ami: Singsi, mimaan kita tayra i omah?
english: What are we going to do in the fields?

ami: Maminengneng kita toya nipalomaan no mita a 'ariray, na'onen yo adihayay ko kakonah ato fitengal.
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

ami: Singsi, tatayra kita i 'alo a midangoy haw?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

ami: Singsi, papaloma kita to dateng i omah haw?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

ami: Iraay ko misaefeeferay a tompo i tira.
Anini paka'araw kako to ma'oripay a tompo.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

ami: Iraay ko misaefeeferay a 'adipangpang i tira.
Yey! Wa! Maolahay kako to'adipangpang, makapahay.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

ami: Iraay ko misaefeeferay a 'adipangpang i tira.
Cowa ko 'adipangpang kora, o fitengal kora.
english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

ami: Itini to a minengneng, aka ka tayra i raay a pala yo!
english: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

ami: Hai, cowa ko tatayra i raay kami.
english: Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

ami: Aka a kacomikay, tayoen ko rakat mapolinaw.
english: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

ami: Halikien ako nga manengneng sanay kako.
english: I want to see them right away.

ami: Pakamaan kiso a tayra i talo'an?
english: How do you go to the block-house?

ami: Pakapaliding kako a tayra i talo'an.
Pakamaan cira a tayra i paisingan?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

ami: Rakat sanay cira tayra i paisingan.
Pakamaan kiso a tayra i Pongho?
english: How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by plane.

ami: Pakamaan kiso a tayra i Pongho?
english: How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by boat.
How does Panay go to school?
Panay goes to school by train.
How does Kacaw go to church?

ami: Sitingsa sanay ci Kacaw a talakiwkay.
english: Kacaw goes to church by bicycle.
Do you go to school by MRT?
No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?
Yes, I go to school by bicycle.
Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?
Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

ami: O si'acefelay anca o hikoki ko nikalican iso a talaPosong?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

ami: O hikoki ko nikalican ako, kalikiay ko hikoki to si'acefelay.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

ami: Pakapaso anca pakapaliding kiso a talakiwkay?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

ami: Pakapaliding kako talakiwkay, pakapaliding ko madepocay to pakapaso.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

ami: Mangataay ko loma' namo to cifa haw?
english: Is the market close to your house?

ami: Cowa kangata, siotofayay kako a talacifa.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

ami: Mangataay ko yofing to kongkoan haw?
english: Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.

ami: Mangataay no siyataw ko kakomaenan haw?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

ami: Mahadak i siyataw lima a fon ko karomakat tahiraay to.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

ami: Ira ko tayal anini, cowa kailoma' kako, cila to.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

ami: Anocila i, ira ko romi'ad iso? Herek no lahok tayra kako tisowanan.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

ami: Nga'ay to, talaen ako kiso i loma'.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

ami: Nga'ay loingen ako ko caciyaw ita haw? O mamikirok kako.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

ami: Cowa kakapah kako, o kofaw han aca ca ho kasolimeten, aka to hena.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

ami: Ano hatira i, sasing han no mako.
english: Then I will just take photos.

ami: Ahowiday to pihayda no miso to pihomong i tisowanan.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

ami: Nga'ay to, o maan ko lalicayen iso?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

ami: Licayayaw ho, o mamaanay ko tayal iso yo kapah ho kiso?
english: What do you do when you are young?

ami: Itiya ho malakincacay kako, mitoysiway to kako no hatini.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.

ami: O maan ko tayal iso hatini?
english: Then, are you working at the moment?

ami: Iniyaro'ay ko aro' no wawa iso haw?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

ami: Cowa, itiniay i tokay ko aro' no wawa ako.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

ami: Ira ko cecay to nipariri'an ako a waco ato cecay a 'ayam, todong to o tamdaw to no loma' ako.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

ami: Pariri'ay kako to cecay a posi, ira ko pinanowang pacafay hay ca kalaholac ko 'orip.
english: I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

ami: Licayaw ho ako kiso to kapaysinan no mi'adopay a demak.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

ami: Ca ka hakowa ko kafana'an no mako, ano ira ko kafana'an no mako pacako han to ako kiso.
english: I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

ami: O sapi'adop namo a talakal iraay ko kapaysinan haw?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

ami: O sapi'adop niyam a talakal, tatiih ko fafahiyan a mitefing.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

ami: Nga'ay ko fafahiyan mitoor a mi'adop haw?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

ami: Cowa kanga'ay, tatiih ko fafahiyan a mi'adop.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

ami: Kacaw, awaay to ko miciw i loma', mi'aca ho to miciw.
english: Kacaw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

ami: Iraay ho i cawka ko cecay a talid, hamanay to a mi'aca!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

ami: Cango'ot ko cecay a talid, tosaen a talid ko ni'acaan.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

ami: Mami'aca kako to miciw, paliwalay kamo haw?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

ami: Tosa a talid ko 'a'acaen no mako, mi'aca ho kako to felac cecay a tafo.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

ami: Ini ko felac, o maan ho ko 'a'acaen iso?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

ami: Mami'aca ho kako to fita'ol, iraay haw?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

ami: Maeminay to a mapaliwal ko fita'ol niyam.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

ami: O kamoko'ay ko caca'edongan a riko' ko 'a'acaen no mako.
english: ant to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

ami: Iraay ko roma a cengel haw?
Iraay ho ko kohecalay ato langdaway.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

ami: Pafelien kako to cecay langdaway a riko'.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

ami: Kacaw, talacowaay kiso i sawni? Miontoay kiso haw?
english: Kacaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

ami: Cowa, patadoay kako to fofoan a mi'aca to dateng.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

ami: Hay han, ira ko romi'ad iso to dadaya haw? Malacafay kita a malafi ano dadaya, makahi kiso?
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

ami: Ca kanga'ay, o mami'aca to riko' kako.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

ami: Nga'ay ho! Pinaay ko 'aca nona dateng?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

ami: Tosa polo' ko 'aca nona dateng to cecay a rorong.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

ami: Tolo polo' ko 'aca nona konga to cecay a tingting.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

ami: Pafelien kako to tosa rorong a dateng cecay tingting a konga.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

ami: Kacaw, matawalay ako miala ko impac, nga'ay pacaliwen kako haw?
english: Kacaw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

ami: Awaay ko no mako, o ni Panay konini.
english: I don’t have one either. This is Panay’s.

ami: Nga'ay pacaliwen ho kako haw? Halikien to ako a patikol kiso.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

ami: Ahowiday, patadoen to kako a miahowiday ci Panay haw!
english: Thank you and thank Panay for me.

ami: O maan ho ko sasaalien iso?
O papatikol kako tona tosa a tilid.
english: I want to return these two books.

ami: Hayda, o maan ho ko sasaalien iso?
english: No problem and what else do you need?

ami: O mamicalw ho kako tona tolo a tilid.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

ami: Hayda, haratengen to tolo a romi'ad patikolen a patayni. yo.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

ami: Cowa ho patikol kiso to sasipasip ako.
english: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

ami: Mana awa a ma'araw koya sasipasip no mako.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to Kacaw?
I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

ami: Pacaliw han ho ako kiso to sasipasip ako.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

ami: Panay, o nipacaliwan ni Kacaw tisowanan koni a kayto haw?
english: Panay, did Kacaw lend you this coat?

ami: Cowa, o ni'acaan no wina ako to hamako konini.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

ami: Mahecaday ko kayto ni Kacaw to no miso.
english: Kacaw’s coat is the same as yours.

ami: O kohetingay ko kayto nira, cowa kahlalecad ko cengel niyam.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

ami: Panay, micaliwan iso ko payci ni Kacaw haw?
english: Panay, did you borrow money from Kacaw?

ami: Hai, o papatikolen no mako cira anini, matawalay no mako a mihawikid ko payci.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?

ami: Anocila hanto ako a patikol cira.
english: I will return to him tomorrow.

ami: Hayda, sowal hanto ako ci Kacaw.
english: Okay, I will tell Kacaw for you.

ami: O fakeloh ko sapi'enec to 'edo a mi'adop, o wa'il ko sapitalakal to tolok, matatodongay haenen.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

ami: Mahaenay han, mararaway ko demak ako! Salaw awa ko ma'adpay no mako.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

ami: Pakafana'en ho ako kiso misanga' tona tosa a satalakal.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

ami: Hayda! Tadanga'ayay to! Ano miliyaw mi'adop haenen to ako a mitalakal nga' citama'.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

ami: Alaen ko kawkaw i kofaw, tayra kita i omah mifariw to semot, 'akawangay to ko semot i omah.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

ami: Itiraay i fati'ian no tanomal, comod sa kiso ma'araw to.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

ami: Na'onen miala, cihinangay ko kawkaw kiya!
english: Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

ami: Icowaan iso miteli ko talakal iso?
I kaeno nora kilang ko talakal no mako.
english: My trap is under that tree.

ami: Ira ko nikonisan ako ini, mansa mafana' to kako, icowaan ako miteli ko talakal ako.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

ami: O foefo koni, telien niyam i lawac no 'alo a mifoting.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

ami: Awaay ko foefo tamiyanan, pacemot hananay ko pifoting i tamiyanan.
english: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

ami: Ca ho pitanam kako a mipacemot, cila to pakafana' han to kako makena?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

ami: Hayda, cila to lacafay sato kita a mipacemot.
english: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

ami: Liyaw to a romi'ad pakafana' han to ako kiso a misanga' to foefo.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

ami: Tatemikay to ko sapacemot iso, mapacemotay to ko foting alatek, halikien a mitengteng.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

ami: Aka ho, ngiyangi sanay ko tamina. Itini sa kako mitengteng to sapacemot, patadoen ho kako miala to salil itira.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

ami: Tengtengen patayni kora foting, patadoen no mako kiso a mitengteng.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

ami: Wata! Makadofah anini, tomes sanay ko faroro.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

ami: Halikien a minokay palilamen no mita ko salawinawina.
english: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

ami: Aka to pisalama, Kamaro' to i hakenang.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

ami: O sakalima, Pahanhan anocila, malacafay kita a misalama!
english: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

ami: O sakatolo anocila, Misalama kita to mali anocila to ikor no kalahokan!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

ami: O pa'aliwacan anocila, O tatayra kako ato ina ako i kiwkay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

ami: Saka'otaaw sanay kako, Tayra ho kako i tata'iyan.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

ami: Hinefa sa ho kiso a pahanhan.
Singsi, adadaay ko tiyad ako, Tayra ho kako i tata'iyan.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

ami: Nga'ay a misawsaw kako to kamay haw?
english: May I go wash my hands?

ami: Papahanhan to, anohoni to a tayra.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

ami: Singsi, adada sanay ko fongoh ako, Pahanhan kako i ikor no kalahokan.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

ami: Hayda, na'onen ko rakat a minokay.
english: Okay, take care and go home.

ami: Singsi, papahanhan kako anocila sakacecay no mitiliday, O papaising kako.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

ami: Adadaay ko tiyad nira, Itiraay i tata'iyen cira.
english: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

ami: Singsi, adadaay ko takolaw ni Kacaw, Pahanhanay anini.
english: Teacher, Kacaw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

ami: Si Caki kako, Moetepay to ko mihecaan ako.
english: My name is Caki, and I’m 10 years old.

ami: Si Caki ko ngangan no mako.
O maan ko finacadan no miso?
english: What ethnic group are you from?

ami: Saheto o Yencomin ko paro no loma' namo haw?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

ami: Hai, saheto o 'Amis ko paro no loma' niyam.
english: Yes, my whole family is Amis.

ami: Saheto o 'Amis ko paro no loma' iso haw?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

ami: Cowa, o wama ako i, o 'Amis; o ina ako i, o Payrang.
english: No, my father is Amis, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

ami: O wawa ni Mayaw Lahok kako.
O ama iso kora haw? Pinaay to ko mihecaan nira?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

ami: O ama iso kora haw? Pinaay to ko mihecaan nira?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

ami: Cowa, o kalas no niyaro' cira, falo polo' to ko mihecaan nira.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

ami: Pina to ko mihecaan no kaka iso to fa'inayan?
Moetep ira ko falo ko mihecaan no kaka ako.
Adihayay ko kaikaka no mihecaan no kaka iso tisowanan haw?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

ami: Lima a mihecaan ko kalala'ed no mihecaan niyam.
Cecay so'ot ira ko sepat polo' a kongfen ko 'akawang ako.
Halafin to caay kasaso'araw, 'akawangay to kiso haw?
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

ami: Hai, Cecay so'ot ira ko tolo polo' ko 'akawang ako.
Hai, tolo polo' to ko tingting ako.
Tatayra i katayalan no singsi mikilim to singsi.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.
He's going to throw away the trash.

ami: Itira i pidangoyan ko mira, o mamilifet cira a midangoy anohoni.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

ami: Icowaay ci Panay? O mamilifet cira a comikay anohoni.
english: Where is Panay? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

ami: Itiraay i Li-tang cira, pohayen ako cira.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.
Let's go to the playground together.

ami: Mi'aca ho kako to sakalahok, anosoni kilimen ako kiso.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.
Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

ami: Kilimen ko tao, o mamikilim ho kako to singsi.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

ami: O mamilifet ci Kacaw to mimaliay to coy-ciw haw?
english: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?

ami: Cowa, o mamilifet ko mira to miterocay.
english: No, he's competing in high jump.

ami: O mamilifet kiso toya piongtokayan haw?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

ami: O mamilifet kiso toya piontokayan haw?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?
What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

ami: O papaliwal kita to kakaenen toya piontokayan haw?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

ami: Cowa, o papaliwal kita to sifaliay a mali.
Sakacecay ko ngangan iso yo, idahiyay to!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!

ami: Iraay i loma' ko fofo haw?

english: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

ami: Iraay i loma' ko fofo haw?
Awaay, mahadakay cira, dadaya nga, minokayay.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

ami: Iraay i loma' ko akong haw?
Iraay i kafekang o sakarosa a tingroh, kilimen cira.
english: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

ami: Iraay ko tamdaw i loma' haw?
Ci Kacaw ha! Halafin to cowa ka'araw kiso. Nga'ayay ho ko miso?
english: It’s Kacaw. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

ami: Nga'ayay! Malaholol ho kita sa kako.
english: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

ami: Micepetay cira to koko' i pakoko'an.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

ami: Awaay i loma' ko akong namo, itiraay i omah cira. i loma' sa ho kamo a mitala ciraan.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

ami: Halafin to cowa ka'araw kiso, 'akawangay to kiso.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

ami: Mahemek ko faloco' to katayni iso.
english: It’s so good to see you.

ami: O papafelien kamo tona onglay, pingsyangen.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

ami: Halafin sa, awa ho a tayni, pohayen ho ako cangra a mapolong a malahok.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

ami: Hapimaan, ocya sa ko nananomen ako, itira kita i palafangan a malaholoholol.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

ami: Ahowiday to pihamham iso. Minokay to kako.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

ami: Maherekay to a mili'opih koni koko', panokayen cedeng han iso a komaen.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

ami: Matatatek kita to cikang, to herek no lahok anocila, nga'ay haw?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

ami: Nga'ay to. Icowa kita a masaso'araw?
I kongkoan kita, nga'ay haw? O mamiloing kita.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

ami: Ano hatira i, tayra kita i sefi. Sicaedong kako.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

ami: Makapahay ko sakora a hana no niyaro'. Yo macelak ko hana i, kilimen kako haw!
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

ami: Ano hatira i, i kiloma'an kiso a tayni!
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

ami: Mana malinah a minokay kiso i niyaro' a maro'?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.
Why not teach in the city?

ami: Naw han i, ma'ololay kako to niyaro' ako, miharateng haca paco'ay to niyaro'.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

ami: Mafana' kiso a mitenooy, cima ko pakfana'ay i tisowanan?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

ami: O fofo ako. O samafana'ay a mitenooy i niyaro' cira.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

ami: Mana miharateng a minanam a mitenooy kiso?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

ami: O serangawan ita ko tenooy, sapipatenakaw kako to serangawan ita.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

ami: Sanga'ay sa a nanomen kona epah.
Tadaidahiyay to kiso, halafinay a misanga' tona epah haw?
english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

ami: Cowa kahalafin. Maedeng cecay a lipay nga'ayay to. Rahekaden ho ko doway ato felac, palamlamen to otong a mitiyol nga, nga'ayay to a paroen i koreng.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

ami: Ira ko 'adiyamay ato lokiw. Saheto o mipalomaan ako yo!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

ami: Tosa so'ot lima polo' ira ko lima a limood.
Maolah kako tona riko', pina ko 'aca nira?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

ami: Lima so'ot a limood koni a riko'.
'Atekakay, cowa kanga'ay a lowanen to mamang haw?
english: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

ami: Cowa kanga'ay, ano lowanen i, masiponay kako.
english: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

ami: Mi'aca kako toni po'ot ato inian a dangah.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

ami: Polong han tosa lefot a limood. O misanga'an ako koni, o hahalafin a sakadademak.
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

ami: Siwkayen ako ko widang a mi'aca, nga'ay kaemeden to mamang haw?
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

ami: Hayda! Papiteken ako to falo ko 'aca.
english: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

ami: Katayni a minengneng! Ira ko riko' ato kafong itini.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

ami: Licayaw ho, pinaay ko 'aca noni riko'?
Tolo so'ot lima polo' ko 'aca no cecay, hatolo han i, molefot ko 'aca.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

ami: Cecay aca ko mi'acaan ako, pafelien kako to faelohay.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

ami: Nga'ay ho, mi'aca kako to hakhak ato siimocay a titi.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

ami: Maeminay to ko hemay. Iraay ho ko sitana'ay a yo-ping, mi'aca kiso?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

ami: Hayda! Pafelien kako to cecay, cila to nga, mi'aca kako to hemay.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

ami: Hay, padangen ako kiso a miparo i kalasay. Lima polo' a limood ko 'aca.
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

ami: Nga'ay ho. pasifanaen no singsi samaanen sano Amisen a pasowal ko kakaenen hananay anini.
english: Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Ami language for food.

ami: Mafana'ay a mitengil to sowal no singsi haw?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

ami: singsi, mafokilay kako, ngaayay ho miliyaw a somowal haw?
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

ami: awaay matengil ako, ngaayay taangayen ko ngiha haw?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

ami: nengnengen i tini! do^doen kako a miosi.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

ami: liyawen ho kinacecay. taangayen ko ngiha.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.

ami: caliwen ho ko sasipasip no kapot.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

ami: pacaliwen ho kako to sasipasip haw?
tahini aca ko pinanam no mita, ancila han to a minanam.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

ami: o wawa ni Sifo kako, ci Kalang kako.
english: I am the son of Sifo, and my name is Kalang.

ami: o mitiliday ni Kalang kako, ci Ayal kako.
english: I am a student in Kalang, my name is Ayal.

ami: ci Ayal ko ngangan no mako.
cima ko ngangan no wama no miso?
ci Fihil ko ngangan no wama no mako.
o kaka ako cingra, ci Daya cingra.
english: He is my brother, his name is Daya.

ami: ci Fihil ko ngangan ningra haw?
hai, ci Fihil ko ngangan ningra.
ci Fihil ko ngangan ningra haw?
cowa, ci Daya ko ngangan ningra.
ci Osay cingra. o fai ako cingra.
o widang ako cingra, ci Lamen ko ngangan ningra.
english: She is my friend and her name is amen.

ami: mo^etep ira ko tosa to ko mihecaan ningra.
pina to ko mihecaan no wama iso?
lima polo' to ko mihecaan no wama ako.

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

ami: tatosa ko kaka, cecay ko safa ako.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

ami: papina ko paro no loma' namo?
english: How many people are in your family?

ami: sasepat ko paro no loma' niyam.
english: There are four of us in our family.

ami: o manan ko tayal no faki iso?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?

ami: iraay ko tayal no kaka iso haw?
english: Does your sister have a job?
Yes, I am an [Amis]. *[Amis] please replace with the respective ethnic group.

ami: o Yencoming ko wina iso haw?

english: Yes, but she is a Puyuma.

ami: hai, akawang ko paro no loma' niyam.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

ami: mitiliday to ko safa iso haw?
english: Does your sister go to school?

ami: mafana'ay a somowal to caciyaw no 'Amis ko safa iso haw?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

ami: hai, mafana' cangra a somowal to caciyaw no 'Amis.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

ami: Malacafay a maro' i loma' kiso to wama wina iso haw?
english: Do you live with your parents?

ami: hai, malacafay a maro' i loma' kako to wama wina ako.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

ami: malacafay a maro' i loma' kiso to fofofofoan iso haw?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

ami: cowa, cowa ka malacafay a maro' i loma' cangraan.
english: No, I didn’t live with them.

ami: Cima ko cafay iso maro' i loma'?
malacafay kako a maro' i loma to wama wina kaka ako.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

ami: i Kangcang ko niyaro' no mako.
hacowa a minokay kiso i niyaro'?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

ami: pipahanhanan no pitilidan minokayay to kako.
english: I will go back in the summer.

ami: masadakay to ko cidal, faedet ko romi'ad.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

ami: cowa ka faedet, cowa kasi^enaw, saemelay.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

ami: masamaanay ko romi'ad no dadaya anini?
awaay ko olol no kakarayan, masadakay to ko fois.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

ami: Katomerep i sawni ko orad,macidalay to,masadak to ko talakal ni Idek.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
We're going to have a big storm here.

ami: fangcal ko romi'ad itira kisonan haw?

english: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

ami: si^naway ko romi'ad, taedipen a ci riko'.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

ami: kakerengay i sawni, ansawni maorad to.
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

ami: maoraday i sawni, tomerepay to ko orad hatini.
english: It just rained, and now it's stopped.

ami: hato maoraday i sawni, macepa'ay ko lalan.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

ami: maoraday i papotal, cowa ka ci dinay kako.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

ami: taangayay ko fali, adada sanay ko fongoh mafiwfiw no fali .
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

ami: taangayay ko cidal, halileng ko fongoh mapacidal.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

ami: Matawalay ko no mako, ata miaca kita.
english: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

ami: Hayda, miaca ho kako to sasipasip.
english: Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

ami: Aka to, maranamay to kako i loma'.
english: No, I've already eaten at home.

ami: matawalay mifaedet ko patafoan no mako.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

ami: Malacafay kita komaen to patafoan no mako.
english: Then let's eat my lunch box together!

ami: O manan ko kakaenen iso to kalahokan?
english: What are you having for lunch?

ami: Komaen to sakalahok no pitilidan kako.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.

ami: O manan ko kakaenen iso to kalahokan?
english: What are you having for lunch?

ami: Iraay ko mialaan ako a patafoan, malacafay kita komaen!
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?

ami: padangen ho kako miala to saasik.
english: Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here's a broomstick for you.
Can you help me with the cloth?
I'm sweeping the floor and you ask Sawmah to help you.
The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I'll go get the cloth.
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

ami: Aka ho, cowa ho malaheci a miasik itini.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.
What do you do after school?

ami: miromadiw kako ato widang no mako.
english: I'm going to sing with my friends.

ami: Iraay ci Kaying i loma' haw?

english: She’s at home, please come in.

ami: Iraay ci Lamen i loma' haw?
english: May I ask if Lamen is home?

ami: Awaay i loma' cingra, nimaan kiso?
english: She’s not here, what can I do for you?

ami: Fofo, ci Lipih kako, fohaten ho ko saedef.
english: Grandpa, I’m Lipih, please open the door.

ami: Ci Siko kako, tayni kako a miholol.
english: I’m Siko, and I’ve come to play with you.

ami: Hai, mailol kako kisonan, kapicomod miholol.
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

ami: Hayi! fangcal kona losay a nengnengen.
Kaesoay ko losay a kaenen haw?
Maherekay to ni ina a misakalafi, halikien a tayni komaen.
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

ami: Hayi, minanaw ho to kamay kako.
english: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

ami: Adihayay to ko nikaenan no mako, mafecolay to kako.
english: I ate a lot, I’m full.

ami: Adihayen ko ni kaenan, aka ngodo.
Miliyas to kako, tayni sato kako a miliso kisonan anoci:la.
english: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

ami: Hai, tayni sato i loma' no mako a misalama
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

ami: Nga'ay ho, tahidangen no singsi kamo a miliso to malitengay no niyaro' anini.
english: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

ami: Fofo, tayniay to kami a miliso kisonan.
english: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

ami: Mafana'ay kamo a caciyaw to no 'Amis ha! tada fangcal!
Nga'ay ho, tahidangen no singsi kamo tayra i omah no lamelo a maomah.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

ami: Tayni a midado'do' mapolong, alaen ko sakimaomah.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

ami: Hai singsi, nialaan to niyam ko sakimaomah.
english: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.

ami: Alaen ko sapilaplap to ayam a tekap kiso.
english: You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

ami: Ngaay ho, tatayla kita i loma' no aadopen anini.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

ami: Aciyah ka fangcal! o maan ko sakatayra ita?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

ami: Hongilaen ko pido'do', miaca kita to paya.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

ami: O ayam ko i kaayaway , o oner ko I kaikolay, niyah sa a miaraw.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

ami: Ngaay to, miaraw kiso to ayam.
english: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

ami: Cecay a tatokian minokay a masaopo.
english: We’ll be back in an hour.

ami: O manan ko manengnengay no miso anini?
Adihayay ko oner, ira ho ko ayam ko manengnengay no mako.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

ami: Talaen ho kako, marorayay to ko o'o no mako.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

ami: Angongolay ko nanom itira, itini sa kita a midangoy.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

ami: O manan ko sa katayni no miso?
O manan ko nikalican iso a paliding?
english: What kind of car did you take?

ami: O paso ko nikalican ako a tayni.

english: How do you go to church?

ami: Pakalican no wama no mako a tayra.
O manan ko saka tayra ningra i pitilidan to romi'ami'ad?
english: How does he usually go to school?

ami: O mimokmokay a kasoling ko sakatayra ningra i pitilidan.
english: He took the subway to school.

ami: O manan ko sakatayra no fofo iso a miaca to dateng?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

ami: Ci ongtofayay cingra a miaca to dateng.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

ami: O manan ko sakatayra iso i Fotod?
english: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

ami: O tamina ko saka tayra ako i Fotod.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?

ami: O hikoki ko saka tayra ningra i Fotod.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

ami: O manan ko nikalican ningra tayra I Takaw?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

ami: O pafesocay a kasoling ko sakatayra ningra i Takaw.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

ami: o kasoling ko sakatayra ningra i Posong haw?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

ami: Hai, o kasoling ko sakatayra ningra i Posong.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

ami: o kasoling ko sakatayra ningra i Posong haw?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

ami: Cowa, o hikoki ko sakatayra ningra i Posong.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

ami: Iraay ko siyataw no paso itini haw?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

ami: Iraay, moecel han ko rakat, manengneng to ko siyataw no paso.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

ami: I cowaay ko mangataay no mimokmokay a kasoling no siyataw itini?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

ami: Awaay ko mimokmokay a kasoling itini , pakahaya sa kiso.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

ami: Halafin a mikalic to paso tayra i pitilidan haw?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

ami: Mo^tep ira ko lima a efon tahila i pitilidan.
Mikalic to pafesocay a kasoling ,hacowa a tahila i Taycong?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

ami: Cecay ko toki tahila i Taycong.
english: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

ami: parakat to paliding halafing a tahila i Olay haw?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

ami: Mikalic to mimokmokay a kasoling kiso i, hacowa a tahini i loma' ako?
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

ami: Ngaay kako a palicay tisowanan haw?
Ngaay kako a palicay tisowanan haw?
Aka to, cowa ka adihay ko kafana'an ako.
english: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

ami: Ira ko romi'ad iso to harek no lahok haw? sapilisoaw kako tisowanan, ngaay haw?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

ami: Ngaay to, i loma' sa kako a mitala kisonan.
english: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

ami: Ira ko romi'ad iso anocila haw? iraay ko lalicayen ako tisowanan to tawcikel no to'as.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the [Amis]. *Please change [Amis] to your respective tribe.

ami: tala lotok anocila,. awa kako i loma'.
english: I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

ami: O matengilay i, mafanaay kiso to kakawa no litengan ,o sapilicay no mako tisowanan.
english: I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Amis, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

ami: co kaadihay ko kafana'an no mako, kawrira i pacaofen ako kiso to kafanaan ako.
english: I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

ami: ngaay kako milokoing haw? nga ngaay a lisopsopen to ikol.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

ami: Pina to ko mihecaan no miso?
Siwa polo' ira ko falo to ko mihecaan no mako.

english: I’m from [Matthew’s Saddle]. *Please change [Matthew Saddle] to an ethnic location.

ami: O 'Amis ko fafahi no miso haw?
english: Is your wife also [Amis]? *Please change \Amis\" to your ethnic group."

ami: Mafana' kiso somowal to rama a caciyaw no finacadan haw?
Mafana' kako caciyaw to sowal no 'Amis ato no Ponong.
english: I can speak Ami and Bunun.

ami: Tada mahemek ko faloco' a palicay tisowanan, pakayni tona miadopay a lisin ngaay haw a sowalen?
english: It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

ami: Hayi, kako a miadop i kaemang ho.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

ami: Akowiday, fangcal ko pakafana' no miso.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

ami: soelinay ko sowal no mako to kimad no to'as.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

ami: tahini aca ko palicay i tisowanan, Akowiday han ako kiso to paini no miso.
english: That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

ami: Aka ngodo, romiad sato a miholol.
Miliyas to kako, ikol to i, nanay matengil ko adihay a kimad no miso.
english: I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

ami: Ngaayho, o manan ko aacaen no miso?
english: Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a cup.

ami: Ngaayho, o manan ko aacaen no miso?
english: Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a hat.

ami: Miaca kako to kopo, paliwalay kamo haw?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

ami: Iraay, pina ko aacaen no miso?
english: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

ami: Awaay, cowa ka paliwal kami to 'icep.
english: No, we don't sell betel nut.

ami: Pina ko aacaen iso a tafo?
english: How many packs do you want to buy?

ami: Pafelien kako to tolo a tafo.

english: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

ami: Maeminay to a mapaliwal ko konga.
english: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

ami: Miaca kako to toso a silasimi.
english: I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.

ami: Pacafayen ho kako a miaca to fitaol.
Pina a tingting ko aacaen niso?
english: How many pounds do you want to buy?

ami: Pina a tingting ko aacaen iso a fitaol?
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

ami: Tosa a tingting ko aacaen ako.
english: I want to buy two catties.

ami: Tosa lolong kenaw ko aacaen ako.
english: I want to buy two green onions.

ami: toloay to a lolong itini, emin han ako a pafeli kisonan.
english: There are three left, all for you!
How much is this bag of rice?

ami: Tosa so'ot ko aca nona cecay a tafo.
Tosa polo' ira ko cecay a limo'od maemin, tosa polo' ngaay to.
Siwa polo' ira ko lima a limo'od itini.
Miaca ho kako, simoot han a misolot.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

ami: Lima so'ot ira ko mo^tep a limood maemin.

english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?
No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

ami: Tolo polo' a limood kona odax, o manan ho ko aalaen iso?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

ami: Ngaayay kako micaliw kisonan to payci han?
english: Can I borrow money from you?

ami: Ngaayay to , hakowa ko cacaliwen iso a payci?
english: Yes! How much do you need?

ami: Matawalay ako a miala to payci, ngaayay a micaliw kako kisonan to payci han?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?
I don’t have any money either!

ami: Matawalay ako a miala to payci, ngaayay a micaliw kako kisonan to payci han?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

ami: Naay, ya nicaliwan iso i nacila a payci cowa ho kapatikolen iso kako.
english: No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

ami: Ngaayay micaliw kako to riko' no miso han?
Ngaayay micaliw kako to tilid no miso han?
Pacaliwan to no mako ci Hokin.
