Pacaliwen ho kako to tingsiya iso?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

ami: Hayda, kawrira i patikolen kako anocila.
english: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

ami: Maoraday to, cowa kapiala kako to dinay, Pacaliwen ho kako to dinay iso?
english: It’s raining, I don’t have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

ami: Cecayay ko dinay ako, malacafay kita ci dinay
english: I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

ami: Yanicaliwan ako i naci:la a tilid, patikolen ako kiso.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

ami: O manan ho ko nanengnengan iso a tilid, pasowal han to kako.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

ami: Hacowa a patikolen ako kiso to payci?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

ami: Ngaay to, ira to ko payci iso itiya sa to a mipatikol.
english: It’s okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

ami: Hacowa a patikol kiso i takowanan to payci?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I’ll return it to you tomorrow.

ami: Hacowa a patikol kiso i takowanan to tilid?
english: When are you going to return my book?

ami: Mapatikolay to ako kiso i nacila kiya?
english: Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?

ami: Pacaliwan ni Hokin kiso tona impic haw?
english: Did Hokin lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

ami: nicaliwan iso ci Hokin tona impic haw?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Hokin?
No, this is what mom bought.

ami: Awaay to ko cinah, caliwen ho ko cinah ni Miding.
english: We’re out of salt, let’s go borrow some from Miding.

ami: Papipatikolen ci Miding to payci ako.
english: Go tell Miding to give me back my money.

ami: pina ko nicaliwan ningra a payci?
english: How much does she owe you?

ami: Tayla kako i padatengan a Mipaloma' to dateng.
english: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

ami: karengos sanay, nifaliway to rengos kako, micefos ho ansawni.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

ami: Taynien ho ko kawkaw ato pitaw?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

ami: I tatihi no kangkang a mateli.
english: Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

ami: I sawniay ho kangkangen ako, nipaloma' ansawni.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

ami: Ngaayay to a sidetengen ko dateng iso haw?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

ami: Ngaayay to a sidatengen ko tamana itini, cowa ho kangaay ko nangkokay a sidatengen.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

ami: Watah! Adihay ko nikorkoran iso a konga.
english: (sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

ami: Pacafayen ho kako a miteli i kofaw haw?
english: Will you help me with the barn?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

ami: Adihay to ko foting i kopid.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?
I shoot fish with a spear.

ami: Mafana' kiso tano pana'en a miadop haw?
english: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

ami: O talakal ko sapiadop no mako, olatek miolong to waco kowang a miadop.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

ami: o nirakatan no fafoy koni a lalan
english: This is the road the boar took.

ami: O salipa' no fafoy koni, mana o nirakatan no fafoy koni a lalan.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

ami: halikien a minengneng to talakal ita, hato ci tamaay to.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

ami: Hato mahanekay no waco, halikien ita tayra a mito'ol.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

ami: O no tanofakelohan a talakal koni sapiadop to edo.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

ami: O manan ko ni telian iso i tira?
english: What is that thing you put there?

ami: O kalala a talakal kora, sapiadop to mancel.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

ami: Miahowid to palemed no tatoasan, adihay ko tama niyam anini.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

ami: Hai, panokayen ita i niyaro' paini to finawlan.
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

ami: O sowal no 'Amis to pinanowang pakafana'en no singsi kita anini.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Pangcah language today.

ami: O sowal no 'Amis to pinarengw pakafana'en no singsi kita anini.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of plants in Pangcah language today.

ami: O sowal no 'Amis to losay pakafana'en no singsi kita anini.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Pangcah language today.

ami: O niRofing kani a riko' haw?
Cowa, o niFayan koni a riko'.
Singsi, matawal ako mihawikid ko tilid.
english: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

ami: Malacafay kako to kapot a minengneng to tilid.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

ami: Pacaliwen ako kiso to sasipasip ako.
english: I will lend you my eraser.

ami: Pahanhan to kita, na'onen a minokay!
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.
The class is over, goodbye everyone

ami: Nga'ayho mapolong, ciKacaw ko ngangan ako.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Kacaw.

ami: Nga'ayho mapolong ciMayaw ko ngangan ako.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Mayaw.

ami: O wina niIsin kako, ciPanay kako.
O safa niIsin to fafahiyan kako, ciAmoy ko ngangan ako.
english: I am Isin’s sister. My name is Amoy.

ami: O singsi ako cingra, ciPiday cingra.
O kaka ako to fa'inayan cingra, ciTahok cingra.
O ngangan no kaka iso to fafahiyan cima saw?
english: What is your elder sister’s name?

ami: O ngangan no kaka ako to fafahiyan ciPanay.
english: My elder sister’s name is Panay.

ami: O ngangan no safa iso to fafahiyan cima saw?
english: What is your younger sister’s name?

ami: O ngangan no safa ako to fafahiyan ciAmoy.
english: My younger sister’s name is Amoy.

ami: Hakowaay ko mihecaan no kaka iso to fa'inayan anini?
english: How old is your elder brother?

ami: Moetep ira ko lima ko mihecaan ningra anini.
Hakowaay ko mihecaan no safa iso to fa'inayan anini?
english: How old is your younger brother?

ami: Iraay ko kongkoan i niyaro' namo haw?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

ami: I niyaro' no kongkoan namo mitiliday kiso?
english: Do you study in your tribe’s school?

ami: Hai, mitilid i kongkoan mahecad to cecay a laloma'an kami.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

ami: O kaka ako to fafahiyan cingra.
O safa ako to fa'inayan cingra.
O nima'anay ko tayal no wina iso?
O nima'anay ko tayal no wama iso?
O safa iso to fa'inayan cingra?
Cowa, o safa no widang ako cingra.
english: No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

ami: O kaka iso to fafahiyan cingra?

english: No, she is my younger sister.

ami: Papinaay ko paro no loma' nangra?
english: How many people in their family?

ami: Lalima ko paro no loma' nangra.
english: There are five people in their family.

ami: Papinaay ko wawa no loma' namo?
english: How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

ami: Awaay ko safa ako to fa'inayan, tatolo'ay ko safa to fafahiyan.
english: I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

ami: Hai, o kaka ako to fa'inayan cingra.
Sienaway ko romi'ad, adihayen a minanom ko faedetay a nanom.
english: It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

ami: Faedetay ko romi'ad, adihayen ko pinanom.
english: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

ami: Ta'angay ko cidal haratengen a mikilidong.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

ami: Adihayay ko 'o'ol, awaay ko cidal ikakarayan.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

ami: Cowa ko mamacidal anocila, ma'o'olay, ta'angayay ko fali.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

ami: Sienawayto anini ko romi'ad, kacikafang a mahadak.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

ami: Nga'ayay koya romi'ad, cowa ko mama'orad.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.
It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

ami: Cowa ka'orad no hatini, mama'orad iikor no lahok, kacidinay a mahadak.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

ami: Wa sienaw i lalomihecaan no katiposan?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

ami: Hai, wa sienaw i katiposan ano lalomihecaan,kaciriko' to kifetolay.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

ami: Anini a mihecaan wa faedet i laloodan?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

ami: Hai, wa faedet i laloodan, adihayen ko pinanom.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

ami: Ma'olahay kako to kacanglahan, diheko ko romi'ad.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

ami: Cowa kaolah kako to kafalawfawan, adihayay ko faliyos ikafalawfawan.
english: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

ami: Matawalay ako a miala ko tilid.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?

ami: Hai, pacaliwen ho kako to impic iso?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

ami: O maan ko kakaenen iso to kalahokan?
english: What would you like for lunch?

ami: O pang ko kakaenen no mako.
O maan ko kakaenen iso to kalafian?
english: What would you like for dinner?

ami: O holo ko kakaene no mako.
O maan ko kakaenen iso a maranam?
english: What did you have for breakfast?

ami: O fita'ol ko kakaenen no mako.
O maan ko kakaenen iso to kalahokan?
english: What did you have for lunch?

ami: O koko' ko kakaenen no mako.
'Ayaw to kiso, sawni to kako tayra mikilim tisowanan.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

ami: Aka to, micolo' ho kita to tilid.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

ami: Caho, mifanaway kako to kaysing no hatini.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

ami: Mirowaro'ay to kiso to ngoyos haw?
english: Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

ami: Mahalek to ako a mifanaw ko kaysing.

english: Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.
What are you going to do after school?
What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

ami: Awaay i loma' ciLapic! ciYoing kako, nimaan saw? tahaloma' to ciLapic sowal han to ako.
english: Lapic is not at home. I am Yoing. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

ami: Fofo, ciYoing ato ci Hongay kami, fohaten ho ko fawahan.
english: Grandma, we are Yoing and Hongay, please open the door for us.

ami: CiRofing kako, mikilimay kako ci Idawan.
english: I am Rofing, I am here for Idawan.
Grandma, I am here to see you.

ami: Wata kahalafin caka tayni kiso, ma'ilol to kako tisowanan.
english: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
Lapic, I am here to play with you.

ami: Kapicomod, halafin to ko pitatala ako tisowanan.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

ami: O nipalomaan ako kona konga, tanamen a komaen!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

ami: Pohay! O nipalomaan ako kona losay, tanamen a komaen.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

ami: Kamaro'! O nipalomaan ako kona 'ariray to cowa kasiwtoken, tanamen a komaen!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

ami: Cowa kanga'ay kako komaen to 'asilo, o lonko sa ko kaenen no mako.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

ami: Podacen no mako ko losay to kakaenen iso.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.
Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

ami: Adihayen ko nikaenan, adihay ko nisafelan ako a dateng.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

ami: Wa! safangsis sa mato ka'esoay a kaenen.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

ami: Adihayen ko nikaenan, ira ini ko adihayay.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

ami: Awaay to ko ngodo ako yo!
english: I’ll make myself at home then.

ami: Adihayen ko nikaenan, ira ini ko adihayay.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

ami: Adihay to ko nikaenan no mako, cato kanga'ay a komaen.
english: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

ami: O kakeriden no singsi a tayra i lotok kamo anini.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

ami: Adihayay ko likes i tolok saan ciIna.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

ami: O kakeriden no singsi a tayra i omah kamo anini.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

ami: O kakeliden no singsi tayra i 'alo kita.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

ami: O kakeriden no singsi kita tayra i tolok.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

ami: Cowa, o kakeliden no singsi tayra i lotok kita.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?

ami: Cowa, o tatayra i omah anini kita.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

ami: Singsi, o maan ko nanengnengen no mita i 'alo?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

ami: Singsi, o maan ko nanengnengen no mita i lotok?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.

ami: Singsi, nimaan kita tayra i omah?
english: What are we going to do in the fields?

ami: Minengneng toya nipalomaan no mita a 'ariray, na'onen adihay ko kakonah, ato fitengal yo!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

ami: Singsi, o tatayra i 'alo midangoy kita?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

ami: Cowa, o maminengneng to tonpo kita.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

ami: Singsi, o papaloma to dateng i omah kita?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

ami: O mamikarkar to sera kita anini.
english: We are going to loosen the soil today.

ami: Ira ko misaefeefelay a tonpo itira.
Anini paka'araw kako to ma'oripay a tonpo.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

ami: Wa! maolah kako to makapahay a 'adipangpang.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

ami: Itini to a minengneng, aka ka tayra iraay a pala yo!
english: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

ami: Hai, cowa ko tatayra iraay kami.
english: Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

ami: Aka a kacomikay, tayoen ko rakat mapolinaw.
english: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.

ami: Samaanen iso a tayra i talo'an.
english: How do you go to the block-house?

ami: Pakapalidingay kako a tayra i talo'an.
Samaanen ningra a tayra i ising?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

ami: Rakat sanay tayra i ising cingra.
Samaanen ningra a tayra i pokoto?
english: How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by plane.

ami: Samaanen iso a tayra i Pokoto?
english: How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by boat.

ami: Samaanen niLapic a tayra i kongkoan?
english: How does Lapic go to school?
Lapic goes to school by train.

ami: Samaanen niSawmah a tayra i kiwkay?
english: How does Saomah go to church?
Saomah goes to church by bicycle.
Do you go to school by MRT?
No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?
Yes, I go to school by bicycle.
Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

ami: Hai, PakaKawti'ay kako a tayra iTakaw.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

ami: O kasoling anca o hikoki ko nikalican iso a tayra i Posong?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

ami: O hikoki ko nikalican ako, kaliki ko hikoki to kasoling.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

ami: O paso anca parakatay kiso to paliding a tayra i kiwkay?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

ami: Tayra i kiwkay parakatay to paliding kako, madepoc a parakat to paliding to paso.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

ami: O ciyn ciya a patiyamay mingataay to loma' namo?
english: Is the FamilyMart to your house?

ami: Cowa ka ngata, pakaotopay sanay tayra i ciyn ciya a patiyamay kako.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the FamilyMart.
Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?

ami: Lima a fon ko karomakat tahira to i ciyataw.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

ami: Ira ko tayal anini awa kako i loma, liyaw hanto a romi'ad.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

ami: Anocila i, ira ko romi'ad iso? helek no lahok tayra kako tisowanan.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

ami: Nga'ayay to, tala hanto ako kiso iloma'.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

ami: Wanga'ay kako miloing haw? o mamikirok kako.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

ami: Cakasanengseng kako a nengnengen, o kofaw hanaca caho kasolimet, aka to hena.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

ami: Ano hatira i, sasing han no mako.
english: Then I will just take photos.
Thank you for accepting the interview.

ami: Nga'ay to, o maan ko lalicayen iso?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

ami: Licayay ho, nimaanay kiso ya kapah ho?
english: What do you do when you are young?

ami: Itiya ho malaImengay kako, mitoysiw to anini.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.

ami: O maan ko tayal iso anini?
english: Then, are you working at the moment?

ami: I kongkoan kako matayal no hatini.
O wawa iso i niyaro'ay ko aro' nira haw?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

ami: Cowa, itiniay i tokay ko aro' no wawa ako.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

ami: Ira ko cecay to nipa'oripan ako a waco ato cecay a 'ayam, todong to o tamdaw no loma' ako.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

ami: Ira haca ko cecay to nipa'oripan no mako a ngiyaw, ira ko pinanowang pacafay hay cakalaholac ko 'orip.
english: I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

ami: Licayen ho ako kiso, pakayni to mi'adopay iraay ko kapaysinan a demak.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

ami: Caka hakowa ko kafana'an no mako, ano ira ko kafana'an no mako paca'of han to ako kiso.
english: I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

ami: O sapi'adop namo a talakal iraay ko kapaysinan haw?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

ami: O sapi'adop niyam a talakal, tatiih ko fafahiyan a mitefing.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

ami: Cowa kanga'ay ko fafahiyan a mi'adop?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

ami: Cowa kanga'ay, tatiih ko fafahiyan a mi'adop.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

ami: Tamih, awaay to ko miciw i loma', mi'aca ho to miciw.
english: Tamih, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

ami: Iraay ho i cawka ko cecay a talid, hamanay to a mi'aca!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

ami: Cango'ot ko cecay a talid, tosaen a talid ko ni'acaan.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

ami: Mami'aca kako to miciw, paliwalay kamo?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

ami: Tosa a talid ko 'a'acaen no mako, mi'aca ho to cecay tafo a felac.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

ami: Ini ko felac, o maan ho ko 'a'acaen iso?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

ami: Mami'aca ho kako to fita'ol, iraay ko namo?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

ami: Maeminay to a mapaliwal ko fita'ol niyam.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

ami: O kamoko'ay ko caca'edongan a riko' ko 'a'acaen no mako.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

ami: Iraay ho ko roma a cengel?
O kohecalay ato langdaway iraay ho.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

ami: Dadada taynien ko cecay langdaway a riko'.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

ami: Aling, talacowaay kiso i sawni? Mionto kiso?
english: Aling, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

ami: Cowa, patadoay kako cifofoan a mi'aca to dateng.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

ami: Hayhan, ira ko romi'ad iso to dadaya? Malacafay kita a malafi ano dadaya makahi kiso?
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

ami: Cato, o mami'aca to riko' kako.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.

ami: Anosanay i, mitoor kako tisowanan a tayra.
english: Then, I will go with you.

ami: Nga'ay ho kiso, pinaay ko 'aca nona dateng?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

ami: Tosa polo' ko cecay a lolong.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

ami: Cecay a tingting tolo polo' ko 'aca nona konga.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

ami: Dadada, pafelien kako toya cecay tingting a konga ato dateng.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

ami: Nikar, matawalay ako miala ko impac, pacaliwen ho kako?
english: Nikar, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

ami: Awaay ko mako, o niPanay konini.
english: I don’t have one either. This is Panay’s.

ami: Nga'ay pacaliwen ho kako haw? Halikien to ako a patikol kiso.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

ami: Ahowiday, patadoen to kako a miahowiday ciPanay.
english: Thank you and thank Panay for me.

ami: O maan ho ko sasaalien iso?
O papatikol kako tona tosa a tilid.
english: I want to return these two books.

ami: Hayda, o maan ho ko sasaalien iso?
english: No problem and what else do you need?

ami: O mamicalw kako to tolo a tilid.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

ami: Hayda, haratengen tolo a romi'ad patikolen a patayni.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.
You haven’t returned me the eraser.

ami: Mana malahedaw koya sasipasip no mako.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to Kacaw?

ami: Cowa to kaharateng no mako, hena licayen ho ako cingra.
english: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

ami: Pacaliwen no mako to sasipasip kiso.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

ami: Panay, nipacaliwan niKacaw to kafang kiso?
english: Panay, did Kacaw lend you this coat?

ami: Cowa, o ni'acaan no wina ako to hamako konini.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.
Kacaw’s coat is the same as yours.

ami: O kohetingay a kafang ko niKacaw, cowa kahecad ko cengel niyam.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

ami: Panay, micaliway to payci niKacaw kiso?
english: Panay, did you borrow money from Kacaw?

ami: Hai, o papatikolen no mako cingra anini, matawalay no mako a mihawikid ko payci.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

ami: Ya hacowaen to iso a patikol?
english: Then, when will you return the money?

ami: Anocila hanto ako a patikol cingra.
english: I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell Kacaw for you.

ami: O fakeloh ko sapitalakal to 'edo a mi'enec, roma i, o wa'il ko sapitalakal to tolok a milamec, matatodongay haenen.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

ami: Mahaenay han, mararaway ko demak ako! salaw awa ko ma'adpay no mako.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

ami: Liyawen haca ako pakafana' kiso misanga' to talakal.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

ami: wata! kahemekan to! Ano miliyaw mi'adop haenen to ako a mitalakal nga' citama'.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

ami: Alaen ko kawkaw ikofaw, tayra kita i omah nifaliw to semot, 'akawangay to ko semot iomah.
english: Go to the warehouse to get the sickle, we go to the field to cut the grass, the grass in the field is too high.

ami: Itiraay ifati'ian no tanomal, comod sa kiso ma'araw to.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

ami: I cowaan iso miteli ko talakal?
I laeno no kilang a telien no mako ko talakal.
english: My trap is under that tree.

ami: Ira itira ko nikonisan ako, mafana' kako to icowaan ako miteli ko talakal.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

ami: O foefo koni, telien no mita i lawac no 'alo a mifoting.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

ami: Awaay itira ko foefo niyam, o pacemot ko sapifoting niyam.
english: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

ami: Caho pitanam kako a mipacemot, anocila pakafana' han to kako?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

ami: Hai, anocila malacafay kita a mipacemot.
english: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

ami: Liyaw to a romi'ad pakafana' han to ako misanga' to foefoe kiso.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

ami: Tatemikay to ko pacemot iso, mapacemotay to ko foting alatek, halikien a mitengteng.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

ami: Aka ho, ngiyangi sanay ko tamina. Itini sa kako mitengteng to pacemot, patadoen ho kako tayra miala to salil.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

ami: Tengtengen patayni kora foting, patadoen no mako kiso a mitengteng.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

ami: Wata! ka kadofa anini, matomes ko kopid.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

ami: Halikien a minokay papalilamen no mita ko salawinawina.
english: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

ami: Aka to pihalama, kalikien a maro' i kamaro'an.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

ami: O sakalima no lipay anini, pahanhan to anocila, ata malacafay a mihalama!
english: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

ami: O sakatolo no lipay anocila, mihalama kita to mali to herek no lahok no cila!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

ami: O pilipayan anocila, tatayra kako ato wina i kiwkay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

ami: Sakaota'aw sanay kako, tayra ho kako i tata'ian.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

ami: Singsi, adada ko tiyad ako, tayra ho kako i tata'ian.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

ami: Manga'ay kako minanaw to kamay han?
english: May I go wash my hands?
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

ami: Singsi, adada ko fongoh ako, mamipahanhan kako to herek no lahok.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

ami: Singsi, wa mamipahanhan kako to anocila a sakacecay no lipay, wa mamipaising kako.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

ami: Adadaay ko tiyad ningra, Ira i tata'ian cingra.
english: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

ami: Singsi, adadaay ko takolaw ni Kacaw, pahanhanay anini.
english: Teacher, Kacaw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

ami: Pakafana'en ho kami to cima kiso!
Ci Noami Kolas kako, mo^tepay to ko mihecaan no mako.
english: My name is Noami Kulas, and I’m 10 years old.

ami: O maanan a finacadan a wawa kiso?
english: What ethnic group are you from?

ami: Saheto o Yencomin ko palo no loma' iso han?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

ami: Hay, Saheto o 'Amis ko palo no loma' niyam.
english: Yes, my whole family is Amis.

ami: Saheto o Yincomin ko palo no loma' iso han?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

ami: Cowa, o 'Amis ko wama ako, o payrang ko wina ako.
english: No, my father is Amis, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

ami: O wawa ni Mayaw Lohok kako.
O wama iso kora han? Pinaay to ko mihecaan ningra?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

ami: O wama iso kora han? Pinaay to ko mihecaan ningra?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

ami: Cowa, o malitengay no niyaro' niyam cingra , falo polo' to ko mihecaan ningra.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

ami: Pinaay to ko mihecaan no fa'inayan a kaka iso?
Mo^tep ira ko falo to ko mihecaan no fa'inayan a kaka ako.
Adihayay ko kaikaka no mihecaan to fa'inayan a kaka iso i tisowanan han?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

ami: Lima a mihecaan ko kalala'ed niyam.
Cecay so'ot ira ko sepat polo' a kongfen ko 'akawang ako.
Halafin to cowa kasasi'araw, 'akawangay to kiso han?
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

ami: Hay, Cecay so'ot ira ko tolo polo' ko ka'akawang ako.
Hay, tolo polo' to ko tingting ako.
Wa tatayra kako i katayalan mikilim to singsian.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.
He's going to throw away the trash.

ami: I pidangoyan cingra, wa mamilifet to midangoyay cingra anosawni.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

ami: Icowaay ci Panay? wa mamilifet to comikayay cingra anosawni.
english: Where is Panay? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

ami: Ira i Li-tan cingra, pohayen ako cingra.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.

ami: Ta mahakelong kita tayra i piontoan.
english: Let's go to the playground together.

ami: Mi'aca ho kako to sakalahok, kilim han to ako kiso anosawni.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.

ami: Ta malacafay kita mililid to patafoan!
english: Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

ami: Kilim han ho iso ko tao, wa mamikilim kako to singsian.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

ami: Wa malalifet to mitekong to mali ci Kacaw anini han?
english: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?

ami: Cowa, wa mamilifet to mitelocay cingra.
english: No, he's competing in high jump.

ami: Ira ko lalifeten iso toya piontokayan a romi'ad han?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

ami: Ira to, wa mamilifet kako to comikayay.
Ira ko lalifeten iso toya piontokayan a romi'ad han?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

ami: Wa mamilifet kako to mitekong to mali.
Mamimaan kita toay piontokayan a romi'ad?
english: What will we do in the sports day?

ami: Wa mamilifet kita to matatengteng to saso'ot.
english: We will compete in tug of war.

ami: Wa mamipa'aca kita to kakaenen i piontokayan han?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

ami: Cowa, wa mamipa'aca kita to kikoya.
Pakaalaay kiso to sakacecay, tadaidahiay to!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!

ami: Iraay ci fofo i loma' han?

english: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

ami: Iraay ci fofo i loma' han?
Awaay, hadak sanay ho isawni cingra i, O dadaya ko pinokayan ningra.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

ami: Iraay ci fofo i loma' han?
Ira i sakatosa a tinglohan, cakat han iso a mikilim cingraan.
english: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

ami: Ci Kacaw fofo han! halafin cowa to ka'araw kiso, nga'ayay ho kiso?
english: It’s Kacaw. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?
I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

ami: Misafelay i cawka cingra , tahidangen ho ako cingra.
english: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

ami: Tayra i pakoko'an cingra milepel to koko'.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

ami: Awaay ko fofo namo i loma', i omahan cingra, i loma' saho kamo a mitala to pinokayan ningra.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

ami: Halafi:nay to caka sasi'araw, 'aka:wangay to kiso.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

ami: Tadamalipahak a ma'araw ko katayni iso.
english: It’s so good to see you.

ami: O sapafeli i tomowanan koni a onglay, na'engen tayra i pinsiyang.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

ami: Halafin cowa to katayni, tahidangen ako ko 'alomanay mapolong a mitaheka.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

ami: Hamaan to malifot, o ociya ko nga'ayay, tayni i palafangan malalicay ho kita.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

ami: Ko'iday ko pipatala iso, maminokay to kako.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

ami: Matokaday to kona koko', panokayen cedeng han ko kakomaen.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

ami: Manga'ay masaso'araw ho kita to anocila a helek no lahok han?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

ami: Manga'ay i pitakcian kita haw? wa mamilo-ing kita.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

ami: I sefi sa mamanay, wa mamica'edong to losid a tayra kako.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

ami: Maka:pah ko kafocerak no congiliw no sakola no niyaro' niyam, kafocerakan no congiliw tayni sato a mikilim i takowanan.
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

ami: Anohatira tahira ho i kacanglahan, halafin tato!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

ami: Mahaen i, pikiloma'an sato ko katayni iso.
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

ami: Milicay ho tisowanan, hano patatikol a malinah tayni i niyaro' kiso?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

ami: Wa mamalasingsi ko kapinokay no mako.
english: I want to return to teach at the local school.

ami: Hano caka i tokay a malasingsi?
english: Why not teach in the city?

ami: Samanen ma'ilol kako to niyaro' ako, nanay ira ko sapipacoay to riyaro'an.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

ami: Tadamafana' kiso a mitenooy, o cima to ko pasifana'ay i kisowanan?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

ami: Ci fofo ako, i niyaro' niyam cingra ko mafana'ay a mitenooy.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

ami: O mitenooyay ko serangawan ita, mangalay midotoc to serangawan kako.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

ami: Idahi:ay to kiso, halafinay ko pisa^epah haw?
english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

ami: Caka halafin, todong cecay a lipay nga'ayay to, i'ayaw rahkaden ho ko ko^tengay a malahakhak, nga, pacamolen to tamod samadahen a mitiyil, maedeng to paro han to i koreng.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

ami: Ira ini ko kamamoday ato lokiyo, sahoto ono niyamay a mipalomaan!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

ami: Ano tosa han ko mi'acaan, wa pina ko 'aca?
Tosa so'ot ira ko lima polo' a lomo'odan
Maolahay kako toni a riko', pina ko 'aca?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?
It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

ami: cato:, ano lowanen mamasipon to kako.
english: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

ami: Anohatira, ora kohetingay a riko' ko 'a'acaen ako.
english: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

ami: Oni a po'ot ato dangah ko 'acaen ako.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

ami: Tosa ca'ol a limo'od, ono nakamayan no mako a misanga'an koni, malalid ko pitatatiw cowa ho kapiciw.
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

ami: Siwkayen ako ko widang tayni a mi'aca, manga'ay ka^meden to miming haw?
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

ami: Hayda! Sakaemeden to tosa polo' a pasento ko hamiso.
english: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

ami: Atiati: katayni a minengneng, ira ko riko' ato talopong itini.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

ami: Licay ho, pina ko 'aca tona riko'?
Tolo so'ot lima polo' a limo'od ko cecay a rikoan, hatolo han ko pi'aca i, cecay ca'ol a limo'odan.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

ami: Cecay aca ko 'a'acaen ako, pafelien kako to fa^lohay.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

ami: Nga'ay ho, wa mami'aca kako to hakhak ato 'imocay a lo-lo.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

ami: Mapaliwalay to ko hakhak. ira ho ko tana'ay a tinpong, mangalay kiso a mi'aca?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

ami: Hayda, pafeli han kako to cecay, cila to 'aca sato kako to hakhak.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

ami: Hay, patadoen ako kiso a mipalo i kalasan, lima polo' a limo'od konini.
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

ami: Nga'ay ho^ mapolong. Misatapang to kita.
Nga'ay ho^ mapolong. Anini^ pasifana'en ako kamo a o maan han no Pangcah ko kakaenen.
english: Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Ami language for food.

ami: Mafana' kamo mitengil to sowal ako haw?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

ami: Singsi^, caay ka fana' kako. Tiyolen haca ari?
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

ami: Caay ka tengil, tata'aken ko ngiha' ari?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

ami: Nengnengen koni. Todongen kako a miasip.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.

ami: Singsi^, matawal ako ko impic ako.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

ami: Singsi^, matawal ako ko sasisit ako.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

ami: Pacaliwen ho^ kako to sasisit iso haw?

english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

ami: O wawa^ ni Mayaw kako ci Kacaw.
english: I am the son of Mayaw, and my name is Kacaw.

ami: O sito^ ni Mayaw kako ci Kacaw.
english: I am a student in Mayaw, my name is Kacaw.

ami: Ci Kacaw ko ngangan no mako.
Cima^ ko ngangan no mama^ no miso?
Ci Mayaw ko ngangan no mama^ ako.
O kaka^ ako ciira ci Kolas.
english: He is my brother, his name is Kolas.

ami: Ci Mayaw ko ngangan niira hay?
Hay, Ci Mayaw ko ngangan niira.
Ci Mayaw ko ngangan niira hay?
Caay. Ci Kolas ko ngangan niira.
Ci Panay ciira. O fayi^ no mako.
O idang ako ciira, ci Imoy.
english: She is my friend and her name is Imoy.

ami: Pina^ to ko mihecaan no miso?
Mo^tep to ko mihecaan no mako.
Safaw tosa^ to ko mihecaan niira.
Pina^ to ko mihecaan ni mama^ no miso?
Lima^ polo' to ko mihecaan ni mama^ no mako.

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

ami: Tatosa^ ko kaka^ ako, cecay ko safa^.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

ami: Ira ko kaka^ iso to fa'inayan?
Awaay ko kaka^ ako to fa'inayan.
Papina^ ko paro^ no loma' namo?
english: How many people are in your family?

ami: Sasepat ko paro^ no loma' niyam.
english: There are four of us in our family.

ami: Mimaanay ko tayal ni faki^ iso?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?
Does your sister have a job?

ami: O Pangcah ko ramod iso hay?
Hay. Takaraw ko polong no paro^ no loma' niyam.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

ami: Micodad to ko safa^ iso to fafahian hay?
english: Does your sister go to school?

ami: Mafana' misanoPangcah ko safa^ iso haw?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many of you brothers and sisters?
We have three brothers and sisters.

ami: Makomod kiso ato ina^ ato mama^ a moko^ haw?
english: Do you live with your parents?

ami: Hay, makomod kako ato ina^ ato mama^ a moko^.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

ami: Makomod kiso ato akong ato ama: a moko^ hay?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

ami: Caay. Caay ka komod kako ato caira a moko^.
english: No, I didn’t live with them.

ami: Cima^ ko tihi^ iso a moko^?
Makomod kako aci mama^ aci ina^ aci kaka^.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

ami: I Fata'an ko loma' no niyam.
english: Our home is in Matthew Saddle.

ami: I Fata'an ko nalacolan no mako.
english: My hometown is in Matthew Ann.
Our tribe is in Matthew’s Saddle.

ami: Anohacowa^ kiso a taloma' i niyaro'?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

ami: I pipahanhanan no lalood kako a taloma'.
english: I will go back in the summer.
The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

ami: Diheko^ anini^. Caay ka sienaw, caay ka faedet.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

ami: Masamaan ko romi'ad anini^ a dadaya^?
Awaay ko kotem, masadak to ko fo'is.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

ami: Salaw saho^ ko 'orad, masadak to ko cidal, ira ko talakal ni Idek.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.

ami: Fangcal ko romi'ad itira i tamowanan hay?
Fangcal ko romi'ad, tata'ak ko cidal.
english: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

ami: Sienaw ko romi'ad, adihayen ko kacifodoy.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

ami: Mafotili' i honi, o mama'orad anohoni.
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

ami: Ma'orad i honi, nika masalaw to imatini.
english: It just rained, and now it's stopped.
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

ami: Ma'orad i papotal, mapawan kako a cicacelakan.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

ami: Tata'ak ko fali^, adada^ sa ko tangal ako.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

ami: Tata:'ak ko cidal, sinawar sa ko tangal ako.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

ami: Mapawan kako mihakiwid to impic ako.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

ami: Mapawa:n kako to no mako. Tata micakay kita.
english: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

ami: Hamaanen, maranam to kako i loma'.
english: No, I've already eaten at home.

ami: Mapawan kako a mietim to tafo^ ako.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

ami: Makomod aca kita a komaen to tafo^ ako.
english: Then let's eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

ami: Citafo^ kako anini^, makomod kita a malahok haw?
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here's a broomstick for you.
Can you get me a rag, please?

ami: Miasik kako. Ka ci Kacaw ko ocoren!
english: I'm sweeping the floor, you ask Kacaw to help you.

ami: Maherek to kiso a miasik hay?
Ci'oning ko kalaeno^ no sapad, sisiten ho oli!
english: The floor under the table is dirty, go wipe it.
Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

ami: Ma'oning kora sasingaran, sisiten ho oli^!
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

ami: Talaen ho, caay ho ka herek kako a miasik.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

ami: Tatalacowa^ kiso i ikor no pipahanhanan?
english: What do you do after school?
I'm going to sing with my friends.

ami: Tatalacowa^ ciira i ikor no pipahanhanan?

english: May I ask if Lisin is home?
She’s at home, please come in.
May I ask if Lisin is home?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

ami: Akong, ci Panay kako. Fohaten ho ko loma'.
english: Grandpa, I’m Panay, please open the door.

ami: Ci Dongi^ kako. Tayni kako miholol.
english: I’m Dongi, I’m here to play.
Yeah! I’ve missed you. Come on in!
Please sit down and have some tea.

ami: Nga'ay to! Fangcangcal a nengnengen kona swey-kwo.
Maherek to ci ina^ a misakalafi^. Dada malafi^!
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

ami: Ka halikaenen! O maan ko kangodoan?
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

ami: Adihay ko nikamaen ako. Tada mafecol.
english: I ate a lot, I’m full.

ami: Itoan to kako. Tayni hato ako ano cilimaw.
english: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

ami: Hay. ano cilimaw tayra hato i loma' ako a miholol. .
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

ami: Nga'ay ho, mapo:long! Anini^ a romi'ad kiriden no singsi^ kita a tayra i niyaro' miliso' to mato'asay.
english: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.
Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

ami: Yay! Mafana' kamo a misanoPangcah! Fangcal!
Nga'ay ho, Mapo:lng! Anini^ tataen ako kamo a tayra i hafahafayan a matayal.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

ami: Ka satisil itini. Matawala ko lalosidan namo.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

ami: Hay, singsi^. Ini to ko lalosidan niyam.
english: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

ami: Nga'ay ho, mapo:long! Tayra kita i tong-o-yin anini^.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

ami: Kasatisil a mapo:long. Micakay kita to paya.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

ami: O 'aya'ayam ko i ka'ayaway. O 'one'oner ko i kaikoray. Namo hato a minengneng.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

ami: Ano matira, ka o 'ayam ko nengnengen.
english: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

ami: Ikor no cecay tatokian patiko^ masa'opo^ kita itini.
english: We’ll be back in an hour.

ami: Adihay ko manengnengay ako a 'oner ato 'ayam.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

ami: Talaen ho kako, matimel ko wa'ay ako.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

ami: Talolong itira, itini han ita a midangoy.
english: The water there is deep, so we just swim here.

ami: O maan ko dakawen iso a tayni?
english: What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

ami: Topinen ni mama^ ako kako to paliding.

english: How does he usually go to school?
He took the subway to school.

ami: Pakamaan ci ama: iso a micakay to sinafel?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

ami: Pakaotofay ciira a micakay to sinafel.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?
I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?
He took a plane to Orchid Island.
What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?
He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?
Yes, he took a train to Taitung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?
No, he took a plane to Taitung.

ami: Ira ko pitalaan to faso^ itini hay?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

ami: Hay, Ira. Do^do^ han kina lalan i, ma'araw ito.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

ami: Icowa^ ko samangataay pidakawan to cyi-yon?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

ami: Awaay ko pidakawan to cyi-yon itini", dengan paka-hay-ya^ kiso.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

ami: Hacowa^ ka halafin ta tangasa^ i picodadan?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

ami: Safaw-lima^ no efon ri tangasa^ to.
Hacowa^ tatokian tangasa^ i Taycong ano paka-kaw-tyi?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

ami: Ano pakapaliding a tala-Ulay i, hacowa^ ka halafin?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

ami: Paka-cyi-yon kiso a tayni i loma' ako, hacowa^ ka halafin?
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

ami: Manga'ay kako palicay i tisowanan haw?
Manga'ay kako palicay i tisowanan haw?

english: Don't, I don't know much about it.

ami: Cilimaw kiso i herek no lahok haw? Mangalay kako mitengil i tisowanan.
english: Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

ami: Nga'ay to. Talaen ako kiso i loma'.
english: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

ami: Cilimaw kiso anocila^ hay? Mangalay kako a mitengil i tisowanan to kongko^ no Pangcah.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legends of the Amis.

ami: Awaay kako i loma'. Talalotok kako.
english: I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

ami: O nikatengil ako, mataneng ko fana' iso to rayray no Pangcah, saka mangalay kako a mitengil i tisowanan.
english: I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Amis and I would like to ask you something.

ami: Caay ka talolong ko fana' ako, nika sa'icel hato ako a paca'of.
english: I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

ami: Manga'ay kako a misya-sing haw? O sakacaloway a mikilok i ikor.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

ami: Pina^ to ko mihecaan iso anini^?
Siwa^ to a polo' ira ko falo^.
O Pangcah ko fafahi^ iso haw?
Pina^ a sasowalan ko kafana' iso?
Mafana' kako a somowal to sowal no Pangcah ato no Piwma^.
Lipahak kako anini^ a palicay i tisowanan. Painien ho kako to pakayniay i paysin to pi'adop haw?
english: It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

ami: Hay, mararid kako a talalotok yo o kapah ho.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

ami: Aray ko pipaini iso anini^ a romi'ad.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

ami: O so'elinay ko nipaini no mako, o nano rayray a nipaini no to'as.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

ami: Hatini aca^ ko pipalicay ako anini^. Aray!
english: That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

ami: Itoan to kako. O tatayni ho^ kako a mitengil to adihayay a kongko^ iso.
english: I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

ami: Nga'ay ho! O maan ko cakayen iso?
english: Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a cup.

ami: Nga'ay ho! O maan ko cakayen iso?
english: Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a hat.

ami: Micakay kako to kop-po^, ira itini haw?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

ami: Ira to. Pinaen iso ko picakay?
english: Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.

ami: Awaay to. Maemin to cakayen no tao.
english: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

ami: Micakay kako to simal tosa^ kofoc.
english: I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.
How many catties do you want to buy?

ami: Pina^ a dadoy ko picakay iso?
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

ami: Micakay kako to kenaw tosa^ falod.
english: I want to buy two green onions.

ami: To:lo^ to falod ko 'osaw, emin han miala^ ari.
english: There are three left, all for you!
How much is this bag of rice?

ami: Cecay tafo^ tosa^ li'an ko pida^.
Tosa^ polo' ira ko cecay pida^ mapo:long. Tosa^ polo' hato ko sa'osi^.
Siwa^ polo' ira ko lima^ kina pida^.
Micakay haca^ kako, sapilepon to cecay li'an no pida^.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

ami: Lima^ li'an ira ko mo^tep pida^ a mapo:long.

english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

ami: Caay ka nga'ay! Ka^me:day to koni.
english: No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

ami: Tolo^ polo' pida^ kina piyang. Mangalay ho^ to roma^ haw?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

ami: Manga'ay caliwen ako ko payso^ iso haw?
english: Can I borrow money from you?

ami: Nga'ay to. Pina^ ko picaliw iso?
english: Yes! How much do you need?

ami: Matawal ako miala^ ko payso^. Caliwen ho^ ako ko payso^ iso haw!
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

ami: Awaa:y ko niawitan ako to payso^.
english: I don't have any money either!

ami: Mapawan kako mihakiwid to payso^. Caliwen ho^ ako ko payso^ iso haw!
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

ami: Na'ay. Caay ho panokas kiso toya nacila:ay.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

ami: Nga'ay caliwen ako ko fodoy iso haw?
Nga'ay caliwen ako ko codad iso haw?
Pacaliwen ho^ kako to koliciw iso haw?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?
Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

ami: Ma'orad to. Awa^ ko cacelakan ako. Pacaliwen ho^ kako to cacelakan haw?
english: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

ami: Oya nipacaliwan iso i takowanan kina codad, panokasen ako i tisowanan.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

ami: Ano ira ko kacifaloco'an iso a miasip, pasowal hato kako.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

ami: Anohacowa^ kako panokas tona payso^ i tisowanan?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

ami: Aka ka caroh, itiya hato cipayso^ kiso.
english: It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

ami: Anohacowa^ kiso a panokas toya payso^ i takowanan?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

ami: Anohacowa^ kiso a panokas toya codad?
english: When are you going to return my book?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

ami: O nipacaliwan ni Kacaw i tisowanan kina impic hay?
english: Did Kacaw lend you this pen?

ami: Hay, o nicaliwan ako anini^ i ciiraan.
english: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

ami: O nicaliwan iso ci Kacawan kina impic hay?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Kacaw?
No, this is what mom bought.

ami: Awaay to ko cilah, oli caliwen ho i ci Panayan.
english: We're out of salt, go borrow some from Panay.

ami: Oli, panokasen koya payso^ han ci Panay.
english: Go and ask Panay to return the money.
How much does she owe you?
I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

ami: Tada adihay kina semot, mifariw kako. Pananomen ako anohoni.
english: There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

ami: Pataynien ho^ koya kawkaw ato pitaw.
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

ami: Telien ako i tatihi no tafi^.
english: Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

ami: Manga'ay to litoden koya nipalomaan iso hay?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

ami: Manga'ay to litoden kina itiniay a tamana^, nika caay ho^ ko lalitoden koya menad.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

ami: Wata:h ka adihay ko nifongaan iso!
english: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.
Will you help me with the barn?
We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

ami: Adihay to i rakar ko foting.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?
I shoot fish with a spear.

ami: Mafana' kiso a mipana' a mi'adop hay?
english: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

ami: Talakalen ako ko pi'adop, tomatira ciwaco^ kako a cikowang a mi'adop.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

ami: O wahkad no fafoy no lotok kinian.
english: This is the road the boar took.

ami: O naripa'an no fafoy kinian, saka o kamakatan no fafoy kinian.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

ami: Katahenay a milido^, mato iraay ko maalaay.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

ami: Masanek no waco^ ko eloh no fafoy. Tata tayra kita minengneng.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.

ami: O sapenec kinian, o sapilepel to 'edo^.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

ami: Ｏ maan kora nitelian iso itiraw?
english: What is that thing you put there?

ami: Ｏ tilo^ to sakiwa'ay, o sapilepel to mangcel.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

ami: Miaray to palemeday, adihay ko tama' ita anini^.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

ami: Hay, pataloma'en ita i niyaro' a pafatis.
english: Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

ami: O fa'inayan a safa^ no mako.
O maan ko tayal ni ina^ no miso?
O maan ko tayal ni mama^ no miso?
O fa'inayan a safa^ no miso ciira hay?
Caay, o tihi^ no safa^ no mako.
english: No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

ami: O fafahiyan a kaka^ no miso ciira hay?
Caay, o safa^ no mako ciira.
english: No, she is my younger sister.

ami: Papina^ ko paro^ no loma' naira?
english: How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.

ami: Papina^ ko wawa^ no loma' namo?
english: How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

ami: Awaay ko safa^ no mako to fa'inayan, tatolo^ ko safa^ no mako to fafahiyan.
english: I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.

ami: Papina^ ko kaka^ ato safa^ no miso?
english: How many siblings do you have?

ami: Awaay ko kaka^ ato safa^ no mako.
Hay, o fa'inayan a kaka^ no mako ciira.

english: How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by boat.
I go to Penghu by boat.
How does Panay go to school?
Panay goes to school by train.
How does Kacaw go to church?
Kacaw goes to church by bicycle.
Do you go to school by MRT?
No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?
Yes, I go to school by bicycle.
Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?
Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

ami: Pakacinamalay iri pakahikoki^ kiso a talaPosong?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

ami: Pakahikoki^ kako, kitahenayan no hikoki^ ko cinamalay.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

ami: Pakafaso^ iri pakapaliding kiso a talakiwkay?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

ami: Pakapaliding kako, kitahenayan no paliding ko faso^.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

ami: Maraay ko patiyamay nani loma' namo hay?
english: Is the market close to your house?

ami: Caay ka ngata^, paka-o-to-fay kako a talapatiyamay.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

ami: Manga:ta^ ko yo-fing nani picodadan hay?
english: Is the post office close to the school?

ami: Manga:ta^, rakat han i, tangasa^ to.
english: Yes, it is within walking distance.

ami: Manga:ta^ ko kamaenan nani cya-taw hay?
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

ami: Nani cya-taw, lima^ seli' no tatokian i, tangasa^ to.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

ami: Mangalay kako a miliso' i tisowanan.
english: I would like to visit you.

ami: Awaay kako i loma', cidemak kako. Cilaen to ri.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

ami: Cilimaw kiso anocila^ haw? Tayra kako i tisowanan i herek no lahok.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

ami: Nga'ay to, talaen ako kiso i loma'.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

ami: Manga'ay kako a milo-ko-ong haw? Mangalay kako a mikilok.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

ami: Caay ka salongan kako, caay haca^ ka solimet ko pa'aririan, hamaanen ri!
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

ami: Ano matira, sya-sing hato aca^ ako.
english: Then I will just take photos.

ami: Aray ko pihayda iso i takowanan a miliso'.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

ami: Nga'ay to! O maan ko lalicayen iso?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

ami: O maan ko tayal iso yo o limecedan ho^ kiso?
english: What do you do when you are young?

ami: O tayring i 'ayaw, nika misawad to kako a matayal.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

ami: Milicay haca^ kako, i niyaro' ko wawa^ no miso a maro' haw?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

ami: Caay, i to-kay a maemin ko wawa^ ako a ma'orip.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

ami: Ciwaco^ ato ci'ayam kako. O malo paro^ no loma' ako caira.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

ami: Ciposi:^ kako, ira caira saka caay ka araaw.
english: I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

ami: Mangalay kako a mitengil to pakayniay i paysin no pi'adop a demak.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

ami: Caay ka adihay ko nikafana' ako to pi'adop, nika ano o kafana'an ako i, ca'ofen ako kiso.
english: I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

ami: Ira ko paysin a demak to pakayniay i sapi'adop a lalosidan haw?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

ami: O sapi'adop a lalosidan i, caay papitefing i tamiyanan o fafahiyan.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

ami: Manga'ay a mihakelong ko fafahiyan a mi'adop haw?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

ami: Caay, caay ka nga'ay ko fafahiyan a mi'adop.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

ami: Anini^ a romi'ad, pasifana'en no mako kamo, o maan han no Pangcah ko 'a'adopen.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Pangcah language today.

ami: Anini^ a romi'ad, pasifana'en no mako kamo, o maan han no Pangcah ko kalopinaloma^.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of plants in Pangcah language today.

ami: Anini^ a romi'ad, pasifana'en no mako kamo, o maan han no Pangcah ko heci^ no losay.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Pangcah language today.

ami: Aka ho^ ka komaen to kakaenen.
O fodoy ni Kacaw kiraan hay?
Caay, o ngayto^ ni Panay kinian.
Signsi^, awaay ko aasipen a codad no mako.
english: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

ami: Kakakomod ato i tatihiay a kapot iso a minengneng.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

ami: Talacowa^ to ko sasisit no mako!
Pacaliwen ako kiso to no mako a sasisit.
english: I will lend you my eraser.

ami: Mamipasa^sa' to kita. Na'onen ko rakat ano taloma'!
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

ami: Nga'ay ho^ mapo:long! Ci Kolas kako.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Kolas.

ami: Nga'ay ho^ mapo:long, ci Tokong kako.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Tokong.

ami: Nga'ay ho^ kiso Kolas, ci Panay kako.
Nga'ay ho^ kiso Tokong, ci Panay kako.
O ina^ ni Saway kako, ci Panay.
O safa^ ni Saway to fafahian kako, ci Lisin ko ngangan ako.
english: I am Saway’s sister. My name is Lisin.

ami: O singsi^ ako ciira, ci Namoh.
O kaka^ ako to fa'inayan ciira, ci Koning.
Cima^ ko ngangan ni kaka^ iso to fafahian?
english: What is your elder sister’s name?

ami: Ci Lisin ko ngangan ni kaka^ ako to fafahian.
english: My elder sister’s name is Lisin.

ami: Cima^ ko ngangan no safa^ iso to fafahian?
english: What is your younger sister’s name?

ami: Ci Api' ko ngangan no safa^ ako to fafahian.
english: My younger sister’s name is Api’.

ami: Mafana' kiso to ngangan niira hay?
Pina^ to ko mihecaan ni kaka^ iso to fa'inayan?
english: How old is your elder brother?

ami: Safaw lima^ to ko mihecaan niira anini^.
Pina^ to ko mihecaan no safa^ iso to fa'inayan?
english: How old is your younger brother?

ami: Lima^ to ko mihecaan niira anini^.
Ira ko picodadan i niyaro' no namo haw?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

ami: I picodadan no niyaro' kiso a micodad hay?
english: Do you study in your tribe’s school?

ami: Hay, matiya o cecayay a laloma'an kami i picodadan.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

ami: Sienaw to ma:mang ko romi'ad, ka halinanom to faedetay.
english: It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

ami: Faedet to ma:mang ko romi'ad, ka halinanomen!
english: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

ami: Tada tata'ak ko cidal, aka ka pawan a misipasip to sakicidal.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

ami: Cicahid, caay ka sadak ko cidal.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

ami: Caay ka cidal anocila^, cicahid, nika tata'ak ko fali^.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

ami: Masamaan ko romi'ad itiya yo pihololan no mita?
english: How was the weather that day?

ami: Sienaw to ma:mang koya romi'ad, ka cifodoy to kifetolay ano masadak.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.

ami: Mama'orad ko romi'ad toya pihololan ita hay?
english: Will it be rainy that day?

ami: Fangcal ko romi'ad itiya, caay ka 'orad.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

ami: Mama'orad ko romi'ad itiya pihololan ita hay?
english: Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

ami: Masalaw to, masadak to ko cidal.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

ami: Hay, ma'orad to, nika caay ka cicacelakan kako.
english: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

ami: Caay ka 'orad imatini, mama'orad i herek no lahok, saka kacicacelakan ano masadak.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

ami: Sienaw ko romi'ad anoroma^ a mihecaan to kasienawan haw?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

ami: Hay, sie:naw ko romi'ad anoroma^ a mihecaan, saka adihayen ka cifodoy.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

ami: O caciferang ko romi'ad i aniniay a lalood haw?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

ami: Hay, o caciferang ko romi'ad i lalood, saka kahalinanom.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

ami: Maolah kako to kacanglahan, caay ka faedet, caa:y ka sienaw.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

ami: Caay ka olah kako to piporangan, nawhani adihay ko faliyos.
english: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

ami: Matawal ako ko aasipen a codad ako.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.

ami: Matawal iso ko impic iso hay?
english: Do you forget to bring your pen?

ami: Hay, pacaliwen kako to no miso haw?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

ami: O maan ko malo sakalahok iso?
english: What would you like for lunch?

ami: O maan ko malo sakalafi^ iso?
english: What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

ami: 'Ayaw to kiso, kilim hato ako kiso anohoni^.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

ami: Na'ay, milinah ho^ kami to codad.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

ami: Na misolac to kiso to wadis hay?
Caay ho^, misawsaway kako to kaysing imatini.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

ami: Na misawsaw to kiso to ngapa^ hay?
english: Did you rinse out your mouth?

ami: Maherek to kako a misawsaw to ngapa^.
english: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

ami: Na misawsaw to kiso to kaysing hay?
Hay, maherek to kako a misawsaw to kaysing.

english: Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.
What are you going to do after school?
What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

ami: Awaay i loma' ci Api'! Ci Ipih kako. O maan ko demak? Ano taloma' ciira, paratoh hato ako.
english: Api’ is not at home. I am Ipih. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

ami: Ci Panay aci Api' kami. Fohaten ho^ ko fawahan!
english: Grandma, we are Panay and Api’, please open the door for us.

ami: Ci Foya^ kako, mikilimay kako ci Okayan.
english: I am Fuya^, I am here for Okay.

ami: Ina^, tayni kako a miliso' i tosowanan.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

ami: Hala:fin to kiso caay ka tayni, mao:ron kako i tisowanan.
english: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
Api, I am here to play with you.
Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

ami: O nipalomaan ako kina fonga^, tanamen a komaen ari!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

ami: Ati Ati! O nipalomaan ako kina heci^ no losay, tanamen a komaen ari.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

ami: Kamaro! O nipalomaan ako kina awaayay ko iyo^ a 'ariray, tanamen a komaen ari!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

ami: Caay ka maen kako to mami^, o ling-ko^ aca^ ko kaenen ako.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

ami: Podacen ako ko heci^ no losay, o kakaenen iso.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

ami: Aray! Adihay ko salang nina heci^ no losay.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

ami: Alaen ako ko nanom, o nananomen iso.
english: I will bring you some water.

ami: Adihayen kamaen, adihay ko nisafelan ako a sinafel.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

ami: Hay haw! Fangsis ri kaeso' ko kaen ako.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

ami: Adihay to ko nikaenan ako, na'ay to.
english: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

ami: Keriden ako kamo a talalotok anini^ a romi'ad.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

ami: Sowal sa ci ina^, "Adihay ko likes i lotok." saan.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

ami: Keriden ako kamo a talaomah anini^ a romi'ad.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

ami: Keriden no singsi^ kita a tala'alo^.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

ami: Keriden no singsi^ kita a talalotok.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

ami: Tatala'alo^ kita anini^ a romi'ad haw?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

ami: Caay, keriden no singsi^ kita a talalotok.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?

ami: Caay, tatalaomah kita anini^ a romi'ad.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

ami: Singsi^, o maan ko nengnengen ita i 'alo^?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

ami: Singsi^, o maan ko nengnengen ita i lotok?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

ami: Minengneng kita to 'ariray a talaomah, na'onen ko rokat, ira ko alonah ato kaketi^ yo!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

ami: Singsi^, tatala'alo^ kita a midangoy hay?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

ami: Singsi^, mipaloma^ kita to sinafel i omah hay?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

ami: Ira ko facacido' a maefer i:raw.
Ani:ni^ a paka'araw kako to so'elinay a facacido'.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

ami: Yay! Ey! Maolah kako to 'adipangpang, fangcal sa a nengnengen.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

ami: Itini: han a minengneng, aka ka tayra i ra:ay yo!
english: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

ami: Hay, caay ka tayra kami i ra:ay.
english: Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

ami: Aka ka fekac, na'o:n han, matolo'a!
english: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.

ami: Kacaw, awaay to ko epah i loma', picakayi ho^ kiso.
english: Kacaw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

ami: Ira ho^ ko cecay kofoc i sefi^, hamaanen ho^ a micakay!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

ami: Caay ka edeng a cecay kofoc, picakayi ho^ to tasa^ kofoc.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

ami: Micakay kako to epah, ira itini i tamowan haw?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

ami: Ira to! Pinaen iso kofoc ko picakay?
english: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

ami: Tosa^ kofoc ato cecay pawti^ ko felac.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

ami: Ini ko felac, mangalay ho^ to roma^ haw?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

ami: O ta'ol ko roma^, ira itini haw?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

ami: Maemin to a cakayen no tao ko ta'ol.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

ami: O aporo'ay ko caca'edongan a fodoy.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

ami: Ira ho^ ko romaay a cengel haw?
english: How about this red one?Do you have another color?

ami: Ira ho^ ko fohecalay ato langdaway.
english: We have white and blue ones too.
Please give me the clothes in blue.

ami: Kacaw, talacowa^ kiso i honi? Miondo kiso hay?
english: Kacaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

ami: Caay, mipatado^ kako i ci ama:an a micakay to sinafel.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

ami: Hay sa! Cilimaw kiso anodadaya^? Malafia ho^ kita a tatosa^ ri!
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

ami: Aya! Maanen aca^, micakay kako to fodoy.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.

ami: Ano matira, mihakelong kako i tisowanan.
english: Then, I will go with you.

ami: Nga'ay ho^! Pina^ pida^ kina sinafel?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

ami: Cecay falod tosa^ polo' ko pida^.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

ami: Cecay dadoy i, tolo^ polo' ko pida^.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

ami: Tosa^ falod no sinafel ato cecay dadoy no fonga^ ko picakay ako.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

ami: Kacaw, mapawan kako to sasorit ako, pacaliwen ho^ kako to no miso haw?
english: Kacaw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

ami: Awaa:y ko no mako, o ni Panay kinian.
english: I don’t have one either. This is Panay’s.

ami: Pacaliwen ho^ kako ri, panokasen ako anoho:ni^.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.
Thank you and thank Panay for me.

ami: Mamipanokas kako tonini a codad tosa^.
english: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

ami: Caliwen haca^ ako kina codad tolo^.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

ami: Nga'ay to. Nika panokasen i rikor no tolo^ a romi'ad.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

ami: Caay ho^ panokas kiso to sasisit ako.
english: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

ami: Talacowa^ to aca^ koya sasisit ako?
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to Kacaw?

ami: Caay ka fana' kako. Tengilaw ho^ ako ciira.
english: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

ami: Pali'ayawen ako pacaliw kiso to no mako.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

ami: Panay, o nipacaliwan ni Kacaw kora ngayto^ i tisowanan haw?
english: Panay, did Kacaw lend you this coat?

ami: Caay, o nicakayananan ni ina^ ako.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

ami: O malecaday kora ngayto^ ni Kacaw ato no miso haw?
english: Kacaw’s coat is the same as yours.

ami: O kohetingay ko niira, caay ka lecad ko cengel no niyam.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

ami: Panay, na micaliw kiso to payso^ i ci Kacawan haw?
english: Panay, did you borrow money from Kacaw?

ami: Hay, kona anini^ kako a panokas i ciiraan, nika mapawan kako a miala^ to payso^.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

ami: Anohacowa^ to aca^ kiso a panokas?
english: Then, when will you return the money?

ami: Panokas hato ako i ciiraan anocila^.
english: I will return to him tomorrow.

ami: Hay, pasowal hato ako ci Kacaw.
english: Okay, I will tell Kacaw for you.

ami: O ta'eref ko sapilepel to 'edo^, o talakal ko sapilepel to tolok, matira ta matama^.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

ami: Hilam haenen aca^! Moraraw ko no mako! Onini ko sakacaay pakalepel no mako.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

ami: Pasifana'aw haca^ ako kiso a misanga' to matiniay a tosa^ a tilo^.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

ami: Hay, aray! Matira i, mamanga'ay to kako a milepel to 'a'adopen.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

ami: Takaraw to ko semot no omah, Oli! Alaen ho^ ko kawkaw i 'ariri^, talaomah kita.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

ami: I tatihi^ no fasolan, micomod kiso to 'ariri^ i, mamaneneng iso.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

ami: Aka piripa' to tilo^ ako yo!
I kalaeno^ nora kilang ko tilo^ no mako.
english: My trap is under that tree.

ami: Ira ko nipatokawan no mako itini, ora ko sakafan' ako to tilo^ no mako.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

ami: O rakar kinian, telien i 'alo^, o sapilepel to foting.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

ami: Awaay ko rakar i tamiyanan, o tiked ko sapilepel niyam to foting.
english: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.
