ami: Caay ka fana' kako a mipatiked, pasifana' hato kako haw?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

ami: Nga'ay to! Malahakelong kita a mipatiked anoci:la^.
english: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

ami: Ano cilimaw, pasifana'en ako kiso a misanga' to rakar.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

ami: Mangangi^ ko tiked iso, alatek cimaalaay a foting! Tengtengen ari!
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

ami: Talaen ho^! Tada tata'ak ko nikangangi^ no lonan. Itini kako a mitengteng to tiked, katayra ho^ kiso iti:raw a miala^ to salil.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

ami: Tata! Taloma' to kita, palada'en ita ko 'alomanay.
english: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

ami: Aka to pisalama^, kamaro' to i kamaro'an.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

ami: Saka pina to no lipay i anini?
Tinomaan i anini, o pipahanhan anocila^, mafolodaw kita a misalama^!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!
Great! Let's go to the riverside.

ami: Saka pina no lipay i anocila^?
english: What day will it be tomorrow?

ami: Tinoloan i anocila^, misalamaaaw kita to mali^ i herek no lahok anocila^.
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

ami: Tinopangan i anocila^, talakiyokay kako ato ci ina^.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

ami: Mangalay kako a mota',talakamisi'an ho kako.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

ami: Singsi^, adada^ ko tiyad ako, talakatomayi'an ho kako.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?

ami: Mangata^ to mipahanhan, nahoni to a tayra.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

ami: Singsi^, adada^ ko tangal ako, mihifang kako i herek no lahok.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

ami: Singsi^, mihifang kako i anocilaay a tinocayan, mipaising kako.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

ami: Adada^ ko tiyad niira, i katomayi'an ciira.
english: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

ami: Singsi^, adada^ ko pi'elokan ni Kacaw, mihifang ciira anini^.
english: Teacher, Kacaw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

ami: Nawiro awaay a tayni^ ci Panay?
Ci Namoh Kolas han ko ngangan no mako, moetepay to ko mihecaan i matini^.
english: My name is Namoh Kolas, and I’m 10 years old.

ami: Cima han ko ngangan no miso?
O wawa^ no icowaay a finacadan kiso?
english: What ethnic group are you from?

ami: O Pangcah a ma'emin ko laloma'an no miso haw?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

ami: Hay, O Pangcah a ma'emin ko laloma'an no niyam.
english: Yes, my whole family is Amis.

ami: O Pangcah a ma'emin ko laloma'an no miso haw?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

ami: Caay, o Pangcah ci mama^ no mako, o tay-wan ci ina^ no mako.
english: No, my father is Amis, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

ami: O wawa^ ni Mayaw Looh kako.
O mama^ no miso kiraan haw? pinaay to ko mihecaan niira?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

ami: Enem polo' to ko mihecaan niira.
O mama^ no miso kiraan haw? pinaay to ko mihecaan niira?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

ami: Cai, o kalas no niyaro' niyam ciira, falo^ polo' to ko mihecaan niira.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

ami: Pina^ to ko mihecaan no fa'inayan a kaka^ no miso?
Safawfalo^ to ko mihecaan no fa'inayan a kaka^ no mako.
Pina^ ko la'ed no mihecaan no namo?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

ami: Lima^ ko la'ed no mihecaan no niyam.
Cecay li'an ira ko sepat polo' ko takaraw ako.
Halafin to caay ka saso'araw, mati:ya^ takaraway to kiso?
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

ami: Hay, cecay li'an ira ko tolo^ polo' a kong-fen to ko takaraw ako.
Hay, tolo^ polo' to ko dadoy ako i matini^.
Talakatayalan kako a mikilim to singsi^.
english: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

ami: I pidangoyan ciira, milifet to no midangoyay ciira anohoni^.
english: He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

ami: Icowa^ ci Panay? milifet to no mafekacay ciira anohoni^.
english: Where is Panay? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

ami: I pipasifana'an ciira, tahidangen ako ciira.
english: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

ami: Micakay ho kako to sakalahok, kilim han to ako kiso anohoni^.
english: I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

ami: Mafolod kita a mikakoy to tafo^!
english: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

ami: Kilimen iso ko tao^, mikilim kako to singsi^.
english: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

ami: Milifet to no mimokonay to mali^ ci Kacaw i anini a romi'ad haw?
english: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?

ami: Cai, milifet to no maeferay ciira.
english: No, he’s competing in high jump.

ami: Milifet kiso i piondokayan a romi'ad haw?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

ami: Hay, milifet to no mafekacay kako.
Milifet kiso i piondokayan a romi'ad haw?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

ami: Milifet to no mimokonay to mali^ kako.
Nimaan kita i piondokayan a romi'ad?
english: What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

ami: Mipacakay to kakaenen i piondokayan kita haw?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

ami: Pakaala^ to sakacecay kiso, tada ka'irayan!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

ami: Ira i loma' ci ama haw?
Hay, ira i kafoti'an a mafoti' ciira.
english: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

ami: Ira i loma' ci ama haw?
Awaay, sadak saho, anodadaya^ to a taloma' ciira.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

ami: Ira i loma' ci akong haw?
I sakatosa^ a tongroh ciira, kacakat kiso a mikilim.
english: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

ami: Ci Kacaw sa, halafin to caay ka'araw kiso, nga'ay kiso haw?
english: It’s Kacaw. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

ami: Nga'ay to! tayniay kako a mikilim kisowan a malalicay.
english: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

ami: Mikeling to sinafel i sefi^ ciira, tahidangen ako haw.
english: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.
She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

ami: Awaay i loma' ci akong, i pala^ ciira, talaen ho ko kafelec.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

ami: Halafin to caay ka'araw, sofac sato kiso.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

ami: Lipahak ko faloco' a paka'araw a tayni^ kiso.
english: It’s so good to see you.

ami: O sapafeli^ i tamowanan kina talacay, i pin-syangen a pateli^.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

ami: Halafin to cai ka tayni^ kiso, tahidangen ako caira tayni^ a malafi^.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

ami: Aka pisamaamaan aca, paociya han kako, i palafangan kita a malalicay.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

ami: Aray han ko pipaini^ no miso, taloma' to kako.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

ami: Herek saho a mipacok tina 'ayam, pataloma' hato, namo hato a micacak.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

ami: Herek no lahok kita a matatala^ i ancila^ haw?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

ami: Hay, icowa^ kita a matatala^ a masaso'araw?
I picodadan kita a matatala^ haw? milo-in kita.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

ami: tala soraratan aca, cilosid kako a tayraan.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

ami: Makapah a macerak ko sakola no niyaro' niyam, tayni hato i kacerakan no hana^ a mikilim i takowanan!
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

ami: Talae:n aca i kacanglahan, tada halafin.
english: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

ami: Ano matira, piilisinan aca a tayni kiso.
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

ami: Milicay ho, hacowa kiso a malinah a tala niyaro'?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

ami: Nawiro cai ka i tokay a malasingsi^?
english: Why not teach in the city?

ami: Ma'ilol kako to niyaro', mangalay kako a paco'ay to niyaro' niyam.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

ami: Mafana' kiso a mitenoon, cima ko pasifana'ay kisowanan?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

ami: Ci ama ako, o mafana;'ay a mitenoon ciira i niyaro' no niyam.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

ami: Nawiro mangalay a minanam a mitenoon kiso?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

ami: O serangawan no mita ko tenoon, mangalay kako a misarayray to serangawan.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

ami: Watah ko fana' iso, halafin a misaeraw haw?
english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

ami: Cai, cecay a lipay maherek to , cacaken ho ko hakhak ato hemay, ta diwadiw han a mipacamol to tomod, ta fa^cal to paroen i 'atomo.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

ami: Ira ko daydam ato lokiyo, o nipalomaan no mako a maemin.
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

ami: Ano hatosa^ han ako a micakay ri, pina^ ko 'aca^?
Tosa^ li'an ira ko lima^ polo' a mapolong.
Maolah kako kina fodoy, pina^ ko 'aca^?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

ami: Watah ka'atekes, keroren to mamang rey?
english: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

ami: Tatiih, ano keroren haca, awa ko lifon no mako.
english: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

ami: Hayda, yana kohetingay a fodoy to cecay han ako.
english: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

ami: Nianay a po'ot ato sioy han ako.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

ami: Tosa^ patek pida^ a mapolong, nakamayan no mako kinian, mihosyo kako caay kalales.
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

ami: Painien ako ko hanghang a tayni micakay, maedeng kaemihen haca to mamang haw?
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

ami: Hayda, keroren ako to tosa^ polo' a pasinto.
english: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

ami: katayni a minengneng yo! ira ko nipacakayan to fodoy ato tamohong.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

ami: Tolo^ li'an ira ko lima^ polo' pida^ ko cecay a fafodoyan, cecay patek pida^ ko tolo^.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

ami: Cecayen aca^ ako a micakay, ka o faelohay ko pafelien kako.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

ami: Nga'ay ho, mangalay kako a micakay to hakhak ato siraw.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

ami: Ma'emin to a mapacakay ko hakhak, ira ho ko nisaepangan to tana', mangalay kiso a micakay haw?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

ami: Hayda^, pafelien kako to cecay, cilacila to kako a micakay to hemay.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

ami: Hayda^, padangen ako kiso a miparo^ i tisakiay, lima^ polo' pida^ a hatini.
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

ami: Nga'ayho mapolong. anini a romi'ad o pakayniay ino kaka^nen ko sapaka fana' no singsi.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to speak Ami for food.

ami: Mafana'ay kiso a mitengil to sowal no singsi haw?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

ami: Singsi, cowa kafana' kako a mitengil to sowal iso. liyawenho kora sowal.
english: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

ami: Cowa ka tengil ako, nga'ay ta'angayen ko ngiha'haw?
english: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

ami: Pasaynien ko pinengnegen. todongen kopi 'osi ako.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

ami: Liyawen a mi'osi. Ta'angayen ko ngiha'.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.

ami: Singsi, matawalay ako a miala ko impic.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

ami: Singsi, matawalay ako a miala ko sasipasip.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

ami: Hatini ko pinanam ita anini. Liyawto a lipay masaso'araw kita.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

ami: O wawa ni Mayaw kako. ci kacaw kako.
english: I am the son of Mayaw, and my name is Kacaw.

ami: Cima ko ngangan ni Ama iso?
Ci mayaw ko ngangan ni Ama ako.
O kaka ako cingra, ci Kolas ko ngangan ningra.
english: He’s my brother, his name is Kolas.

ami: Ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra haw?.
Hay, ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra.
Ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra haw?
Caay, ci Kolas ko ngangan ningra.
Ci panay cingra. o fai ako.
O idang ako cingra, ci Imoy ko ngangan ningra.
english: She’s my friend, her name is Imoy.

ami: Pina ko mihecaan iso anini a mihecaan?
Mo^tep ko mihecaan a ko anini.
Tosa ko safaw ko mihecaan niira anini.
Pina ko mihecaan ni wama iso anini mihecaan?
Limapolo' ko mihecaan ni wama ako anini.

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

ami: Tatosa ko kaka ako, cecay ko safa ako to fa'inayan.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

ami: Iraay ko fa'inayan a kaka iso haw?
Away ko fa'inayan a kaka ako.
Papina ko paro no loma' namo?
english: How many people are in your family?

ami: Sasepat ko paro no loma' niyam.
english: There are four of us in our family.

ami: O maan ko tayal ni faki iso?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?

ami: O fafahiyan a kaka ako cingra.
Iraay ko katayalan ni kaka iso haw?
english: Does your sister have a job?

ami: Itiraay i paisingan a matayal cingra.
O malikakaay cangra a tatosa haw?
O incoming ko ramod iso haw?
O pangcah ko ramod iso haw?
Hay, nikawrira o piwma a fanacadan cingra.
english: Yes, but she’s from the Puyuma tribe.

ami: Hay, mahemekay ko paro no loma' niyam a ma^min.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

ami: Mitilidayto ko fafahiyan a safa isohaw?
english: Does your sister go to school?

ami: Mafana'ay ko safa iso a somowal tono 'Amis haw?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

ami: Malacecayay kiso to ina ato wama iso a maro'haw?
english: Do you live with your parents?

ami: Hay, malacecayay kako to ina ato wama ako a maro'.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

ami: Malacecayay kiso to Akong ato ama: iso a maro'haw?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

ami: cowa, cowa ka lacecay kami a maro'.
english: No, I didn’t live with them.

ami: Cima ko cafay iso a maro'?
Ci wama ako ato ina ako, o kaka ako to fa'inayan Ko cafay ako a maro.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

ami: Ano hacowa kiso a minokay I niyaro'?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

ami: Ano pahanhannan tono kacidalan a minokay kako.
english: I will go back in the summer.

ami: Masadakay to ko cidal, faedetay ko romi'ad.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?

ami: Sienaway, adihayen ko mica'dongan a riko'.
english: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

ami: Anini a romi'ad cowa ka sienaw cowa ka faedet sanga'ayay sanay.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

ami: Away ko to'em i kakarayan, masadakay to ko fo'is.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

ami: Katomerepho no 'orad, macidalayto, iraay ko talakal i Idek.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
We're going to have a big storm here.

ami: Nga'ayay ko romi'ad i tira haw?

english: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

ami: Sienaway ko romi'ad, adihayen ko riko'.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

ami: Ta'angay ko 'orad ano sawni. alaen ko linay.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

ami: Makakelengay i sawni, mama'orad ano sawni.
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

ami: Hato nama 'oraday to, macepa'ay ko lalan.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

ami: Ma'oraday haw? Mana cepa'saan ko tireng iso.
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

ami: Ma'oraday ko papotal, cowa ka cilinay kako.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

ami: Ta'angayay ko fali, adadaay ko fongoh ako tona maiyof no fali.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

ami: Ta'angayay ko cidal, lasang sanay ko fongoh ako tona mapacidal.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

ami: Mahaenay kako matawalay ako, tata mi'aca kita.
english: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

ami: Aka to, maherek to komaen i loma' kako.
english: No, I've already eaten at home.

ami: Matawalay ako a mifa^det to patafoan.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

ami: Matawalay ako a miala ko patafoan.
english: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

ami: Lacafay sa kita komaen to tafoan ako.
english: Then let's eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?

ami: O sakalahok no pitilidan ko kakaenen ako.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.

ami: O maan ko saka lahok iso ano kalahokan?
english: What are you having for lunch?

ami: Mialaay kako to patafoan anini aromi'ad, malacafay Kita a malahok.
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?

ami: Tata misalama kita to yakiw haw?
Patadoen kako a miala to saasik.
english: Please help me with the broom.

ami: Hayda, pafelien ako kiso tona saasik.
english: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

ami: Patadoen kako a miala to kamid haw?
english: Can you help me with the cloth?

ami: Miasikay kako, cikacaw ko papi alaen.
english: I'm sweeping the floor, you ask Kacaw to help you.

ami: Maharekay to kiso a miasik haw?

english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I'll go get the cloth.
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

ami: Akaho, caho kaharek ako a miasik itini.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

ami: Ano minokay kiso namitilid mimaan kiso?
english: What do you do after school?
I'm going to sing with my friends.

ami: Ano minokay ciira namitilid mimaanto ciira?

english: May I ask if Lisin is home?
She’s at home, please come in.

ami: Iraay ci Lisin i loma' haw?
english: May I ask if Lisin is home?

ami: Away ciira i loma', mimaan kiso?
english: She’s not here, what can I do for you?

ami: Kacaw, cimayaw kako, tayniay kako a misalama.
english: Kacaw, I’m Mayaw, I’ve come to play with you.

ami: Halafinto a caka saso araw kita.
Hayi, ma'ilolay kako ' tisowanan, katayni misacaciyaw kita.
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

ami: Wa: nga'ay nanomen kona ociya namo.
Wa: nengenhan nga'ayay kaenen kona kotamono.
Maharekay to ciwina Mitangtang to saka lafi, katayni malafi.
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

ami: Adihayayto ko mikaenan ako, mafecolay kako.
english: I ate a lot, I’m full.

ami: Miliyasto kako, liyaw sato kako a tayni miliso' tisowanan.
english: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

ami: Hayda, ano ira koromi'ad tayni sato misalama.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

ami: Nga'ayho a mapolong, anini a romi'ad tayraen no Singsi kita i niyaro' ami homong to malitengay.
english: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

ami: Akong, tayniay kami a miliso' itisowanan.
english: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

ami: Ha: mafana'ay kamo to sowal no 'amis, tada nga'ay.
Nga'ayho a mapolong, anini aromi'ad tayraen no singsi Kita i lamelomeloan a omah a maomah.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

ami: Masarayaray a ma^min, aka tawalen ko saka tayal.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

ami: Hay, singsi, maalaay to niyam ko sakatayal.
english: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

ami: Nga'ayho a maemin, anini a romi'ad tayra kita i pinengnengan to a'adopen.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

ami: Hayi tadanga'ay, samaanen ita ko katayra.
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

ami: Masarayray a maemin, mi'aca kako to paya.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

ami: I a'ayaw i ono 'aya 'ayam, aikor i o 'one'oneran, paytemek han ita aminengneng.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

ami: Cecay a tatokian itinikita a masa'opo.
english: We’ll be back in an hour.

ami: O maan ko ma'araway iso anini a romi'ad.
Ma'araway ako ko adihayay a 'oner, ato adihayay a 'ayam.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

ami: Talaenho kako, malolayay ko o'o ako.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

ami: Tangongolay i tira, nga'ay itinisa kita a midangoy.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

ami: O maan a tosiyaan ko pikalican iso a tayni.
english: What kind of car did you take?

ami: Mikalicay kako to paso a tayni.
Samaanen iso a tayra i kiwkay.
english: How do you go to church?

ami: Pakalican niwama ako kako itosiya ta malahakelong kami a tayra.
Tohatiniay samaanay ko katayra niira I pitilidan.
english: How does he usually go to school?

ami: Mikalicay cingra to cieying a tosiya.
english: He took the subway to school.

ami: Samaanan ni Ama: iso a tayra mi'aca to dateng.
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

ami: Paka otofayay cingra a mi'aca to dateng.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

ami: Samaanen iso a tayra i fotod.
english: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

ami: Mikalic kako to tamina a tayra i fotod.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

ami: Samanan ningra a tayra i fotod?
english: How did he get to Orchid Island?

ami: Mikalicay cingra to hikoki a tayra i fotod.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

ami: O maan ko pikalican ningra a tayra i takaw.
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

ami: Mikalicay cingra to hacikayay a cinamalay a tayra i Takaw.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

ami: Mikalicay cingra to kasoling a talaposong haw?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

ami: Hayi, mikalicay cingra to kasoling a tala posong.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

ami: O kasoling ko pikalican niira a talaposong haw.
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

ami: Cowa, o hikoki ko mikalican niira a talapong.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

ami: Itini i ngata iray ko pikalican to paso haw?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

ami: Iraay, rakaten tala'ayaw ma'arawto kopi talaan to paso.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

ami: I cowaay ko mingataay to pikalican to cieying a Paliding.
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

ami: Away i tini ko pitalaan to cieying. deng o haya kopi Kalican iso a tayra.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

ami: Ano o paso ko pikalican hakowa ko halafin a tayra i pitilidan.
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

ami: Lima ko safaw a efen no toki tahira i pitilidan.
Ano fesiwpas ko pikalican hakowa ko halafin tahira i tayciw.
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

ami: Cecay a tatokian tahirato i tayciw.
english: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

ami: Cecay a tatokian tahirato i tayciw.
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

ami: Hakowaay ko halafin iso a mikalic to cieying a tayni i loma' ako.
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

ami: Tosa polo' a fen no toki.

english: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

ami: Iraay ko cecay a otofay ako.
Nga'ay kako a milicay tisowanan haw?
Nga'ay kako a milicay tisowanan haw?
Aka, caayka adihay ko kafana'an ako.
english: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

ami: Ano harek no lahok ira ko romi'ad iso haw? tayra kako mihomong i tisowanan sakako nga'ay haw?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

ami: Hayda, iloma' kako a mitala i tisowanan.
english: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

ami: Ira ko romi'ad iso ano papacem haw? Sapi licaw kako i tisowanan tono iti:ayho a demak.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legends of the Amis.

ami: Talatokos kako ano papacem, caka iloma'kako.
english: I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

ami: O tengil ako adihay ko kafana'an iso tono liteng no 'Amis a demak, saka tayraan kako milicay i tisowanan.
english: I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Amis, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

ami: Cowa ka adihay ko kafana'an ako. nikawrira maolah Kako a pasowal to kafana'an ako.
english: I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

ami: Milicay kako, nga'ay a hedoten ako a misasink haw? Nga'ay caloway a matidid.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

ami: Siwaayto a polo' ira ko falo ko mihecaay kako.
Hakowaay ko kafana'an iso a caciyaw?
Mafana'ay kako to sowal no 'Amis ato no Piwma.
anini a romi'ad mahemek kako a milicay i tisowanan, pasowalen haca kako to caay kang'ay a demaken ano mi'adop.
english: It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

ami: Hayda, yo kapahho kako mararid kako a tala tokos a mi'adop.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

ami: Ahowiday, anini a romi'ad a dihay ko pakafana' iso tadanga'ay.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

ami: Oso'elinay kona misowalan ako. o sowal no malitengay konini.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

ami: Hatini aca ko kalalicay ita anini a romi'ad. ahowiday to pakafana' iso.
english: That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

ami: Aka ngodo, liyaw sato kita a malicay.
Miliyas to kako, nanay ano miliyaw adihay ko matengilay a tawciker no liteng.
english: I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

ami: Nga'ayho, o maan ko a'acaen iso?
english: Hello, what are you looking for?

ami: Mi'aca kako to cecay a kokpo.
english: I want to buy a cup.

ami: Nga'ayho? O maan ko a'acaen iso?
english: Hello, what do you want to buy?

ami: Mi'aca kako to cecay a kafong.
english: I want to buy a hat.

ami: Mi'aca kako to kokpo, miliwalay kiso haw?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?

ami: Pafelien kako to tolo a lofoc.

english: I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

ami: Mi'aca kako to simal tosa a talid.
english: I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.

ami: Olili patadoen kako a mi'aca to fita'ol.

english: How many pounds do you want to buy?

ami: Pina a tingting ko 'acaen iso a fita'ol.
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

ami: Mi'aca kako to tosa a falod no kenaw.
english: I want to buy two green onions.

ami: Toloayto kona 'osaw, emin han ako a pafeli kiso.
english: There are three left, all for you!

ami: Hakowaay ko 'aca nona cecay lofoc no felac?
english: How much is this bag of rice?

ami: Tosa a so'ot no payso ko cecay lofoc.
O emin i tosapolo' ira ko cecay a rimood. tosaen aca a polo' a rimood.
Onini siwa a polo', ira ko lima a rimood.
Tongalen to miming. Sacecay han a so'ot a rimood.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

ami: O emin lima a so'ot ira ko motep a rimood.
Limaen aca a so'ot a rimood haw?
'atekakay tato, nga'ay saka emeden to miming haw?
english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

ami: Cowa ka nga'ay, o saka emedayto koni.
english: No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

ami: O na odax toloapolo' a rimood. iraho ko roma a kangalayan iso?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

ami: Nga'ay kako a micaliw to payso iso haw?
english: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

ami: Matawalay ako a miala ko payso ako, nga'ay micaliw Kako to payso i tisowanan haw?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

ami: Cowa ka piala kako to payso!
english: I don't have any money either!

ami: Matawala ako a mihawikid ko payso. nga'ay kako a micaliw i tisowanan haw?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

ami: Ayyah, yamicaliwan iso i 'ayaw caho kapatikolen iso i takowanan.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

ami: Nga'ay kako micaliw to riko' iso haw?
Nga'ay kako micaliw to tilid iso haw?
Pacaliwen kako to tingsa iso haw!
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?
Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

ami: Ma'oradayto, cowa ka piala kako to linay, pacaliwen Kako haw?
english: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

ami: Cecay ko linay ako, cacayat han ita!
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

ami: O micaliwan ako i 'ayaw kona tilid, patikolen ako.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

ami: Ano sapi nengnengan haca kiso to tilid sowalen kako.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

ami: Ano hacowa kako a patikol to payci i tisowanan.
english: When do I have to pay you back?

ami: Mamaan saw? ano irasato ko payci iso itiya hanto.
english: It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

ami: Ano hacowa patikol kiso to payso i takowanan?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

ami: Ano hacowa patikol kiso to tilid i takowanan?
english: When are you going to return my book?

ami: Patikolan to ako i nacila kiya saw?
english: Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

ami: Ona impic omipacaliwan ni Kacaw i tisowanan haw?
english: Did Kacaw lend you this pen?

ami: Hay, omicaliwan ako anini i cingraan.
english: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

ami: Ona impci i omi caliwan iso ci Kacawan haw?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Kacaw?
No, this is what mom bought.

ami: Awaayto ko cinah, katayra ci panayan amicaliw to cinah.
english: We're out of salt, go borrow some from Panay.

ami: Papi patikolen ci Panay to payso i takowanan.
english: Go tell Panay to pay me back.
How much does she owe you?

ami: Tayra kako i sadatengan a paloma to dateng.
english: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

ami: Adihayay ko talod. Mifaresiway kako to talod. raso'en ako ano sawni.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

ami: Padangen kako a miala to kawkaw ato pitaw haw?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

ami: Maharekayto ako a mifelih. Mifolesak kako ano honi to sapaloma.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

ami: Yami palomaan iso a dateng mifangadan to iso haw?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

ami: Ona tamana nga'ayayto a litoden. ora hokoki A talod caho kanga'ay a ritriten.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

ami: Wa: adihay ko mikowisan iso a konga.
english: (sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

ami: Patadoen kako a miteli i kofaw.
english: Will you help me with the barn?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

ami: Adihayay ko foting i tini haw?
Adihayayto ko foting. ira i patelian.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.

ami: Samaanan iso ko pifoting to hatiniay?
english: How do you usually catch fish?
I shoot fish with a spear.

ami: Mafana'ay kiso to o pana' ko sapifoting haw?
english: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

ami: Tohatiniay o talakal ko sapi'adop ako. no latek nga' o Kowang ko sapi'adot ako.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

ami: O mirakatan no fafoy no lotok konini a lalan.
english: This is the road the boar took.

ami: O nasaripa'an no fafoy konini, saka o lalan no fafoy Konini.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

ami: Nengnengen kora talakal ako. mato ci tama'ay to.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

ami: Mato masanekayto no waco ko sanek. kalikien tayra kita.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

ami: O maan kora misanga'an iso no hatini?
O mi'enecan to fakelohan a talakal konini. o sapi tala Kal to 'edo.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

ami: O maan kora mitelian iso i tira?
english: What is that thing you put there?

ami: O miso'otay to 'o'o a talakal kora, o sapi talakal to to mancel.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

ami: Ahowiday ko palemed no liteng, anini a romi'ad a dihay ko tama' ita.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

ami: So'linay, patayraen ita i niyaro'pakowat to finawlan.
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

ami: Pasifana'en no singsi kita anini to samaan han a misano'Amis ko 動物.
english: will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Pangcah language today.

ami: Pasifana'en no singsi kita anini to samaan han a misano'Amis ko 植物.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of plants in Pangcah language today.

ami: Pasifana'en no singsi kita anini to samaan han a misano'Amis ko 水果
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Pangcah language today.

ami: Alaen a pasadak ko tanengnengan no miso.
Alaen a pasadak ko impic no miso.
Alaen a pasadak ko tatiliden no miso.
O no nima a impic koni?
O no nima a tanengnengan koni?
O no nima a sasipasip koni?
O riko' ni Kacaw kora han?
Cowa, o riko' ni Panay koni.
Singsi, cowa kapihawikid kako to tanengnengan.
english: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

ami: Hacafay han ko kapot a minengneng.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

ami: Maketonay to ko impic no mako.
Mahidayay to ko sasipasip no mako.
Pacaliwen kiso to sasipasip no mako.
english: I will lend you my eraser.

ami: Pahanhan to kita, na'onen to ko rakat a minokay!
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

ami: Pahanhan to kita, sanga'ayen to ko no mita.
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.

ami: Sanga'ayen to ko no miso singsi.
Nga'ay ho ci Apetayan ko ngangan no mako.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Apetayan.

ami: Nga'ay ho ci Kacaw ko ngangan no mako.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Kacaw.

ami: Nga'ay ho ko no miso Kacaw, ci Nikar kako.
Nga'ay ho ko no miso Mayaw, ci Amoy kako.
O ina ni Lafin kako, ci Amoy kako.
O safa ni Lafin kako, ci Anay ko ngangan no mako.
english: I am Lfin’s sister. My name is Anay.

ami: O singsi ako cingra, ci Kanas ko ngangan ningra.
O kaka ako cingra, ci Yosi ko ngangan ningra.
Cima ko ngangan no kaka iso?
english: What is your elder sister’s name?

ami: Ci Akiko ko ngangan no kaka ako.
english: My elder sister’s name is Akiko.

ami: Cima ko ngangan no safa iso?
english: What is your younger sister’s name?

ami: Ci Panay ko ngangan no safa ako.
english: My younger sister’s name is Panay.

ami: Mafana'ay kiso to ngangan ningra han?
Pinaay to ko mihecaan no kaka iso anini?
english: How old is your elder brother?

ami: Limaay to ko safaw ko mihecaan ningra anini.
Pinaay to ko mihecaan no safa iso anini?
english: How old is your younger brother?

ami: Limaay to ko mihecaan ningra anini.
Iraay ko pitilidan namo i niyaro' han?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

ami: Itiniay i pitilidan no niyaro' ko pitilid no miso han?
english: Do you study in your tribe’s school?

ami: Hai, hato malacecayay a lalomaan kami a mitilid i pitilidan.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school

ami: O fa'inayan a safa ako cingra.
O manan ko tayal no wina iso?
O manan ko tayal no wama iso?
O safa iso to fa'inayan cingra han?
Cowa, o widang no safa ako to fa'inayan cingra.
O kaka iso to fafahiyan cingra han?
Cowa, o safa ako to fafahiyan cingra.
english: No, she is my younger sister.

ami: Papinaay ko paro no loma' nangra?
english: How many people in their family?

ami: Lalimaay ko paro no loma' nangra.
english: There are five people in their family.

ami: Papinaay ko wawa no loma' namo?
english: How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.

ami: Papinaay ko safa iso to fa'inayan ato fafahiyan?
english: How many younger siblings do you have?

ami: Awaay ko safa ako to fa'inayan, tatoloay ko safa ako to fafahiyan.
english: I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters

ami: Papinaay ko kaka iso to fa'inayan ato fafahiyan?
english: How many older siblings do you have?

ami: Awaay ko kaka ako to fa'inayan ato fafahiyan.
english: I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

ami: Hai, o kaka ako to fa'inayan cingra.
Si^naway to miming, kapinanom to fa^detay a nanom.
english: It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

ami: Fa^edetay ko romi'ad to miming, kapinanom to nanom.
english: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.
The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

ami: tanoto'em sanay, awaay a masadak ko cidal i kakarayan.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

ami: cowa kacidal, mato'em ta'angay aca ko fali ano cila.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

ami: masamaan ko romi'ad toya romi'ad hakiya?
english: How was the weather that day?

ami: si^naway to ko romi'ad anini, kaciriko' to to kifetolay a riko' ano mamasadak.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

ami: makapah ko romi'ad toya romi'ad, cowa ko mama'orad.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

ami: masaesa'ay to ko 'orad, masadakay to ko cidal!
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

ami: ma'oraday to! cowa kapihawikid kako to sa'ong.
english: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

ami: cowa ho ka'orad no hatini, wa mama'orad ano herek no lahok, kacisa'ong to ano mamasadak.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

ami: wa si^naw ko romi'ad to kasi^nawan to roma a mihecaan hakiya?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

ami: Hai, wa tadasi^naw ko romi'ad to kasi^nawan ano roma a mihecaan, saka pakapien to ko kaciriko'.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

ami: fa^det ko romi'ad tona kaciherangan nona mihecaan hakiya?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

ami: Hai, fa^det ko romi'ad to kaciherangan, saka saadihayen to ko pinanom to nanom.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

ami: maolahay kako to kacanglahan, samanen haw i, dihekoay ko romi'ad to kacanglahan.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

ami: cowa kaolah kako to laloodan, samanen haw i, adihayay ko faliyos to laloodan.
english: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

ami: matawalay ako a miala ko codad.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.

ami: malacafay kako i tisowanan a minengneng.
english: I will share it with you.

ami: matawalay ako a miala ko sararop.
english: I forgot to bring the eraser.

ami: matawalay iso a miala ko impic han?
english: Do you forget to bring your pen?

ami: Hai, pacaliwen ho kako to impic iso manga'ay to haw?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

ami: o manan ko kakaenen no miso a sakalahok?
english: What would you like for lunch?\\n8.

ami: o manan ko kakaenen no miso a sakalafi?
english: What would you like for dinner?

ami: o manan ko mikaenan no miso a sakaranam?
english: What did you have for breakfast?

ami: o fita'ol ko mikaenan no mako.
o manan ko mikaenan no miso a sakalahok?
english: What did you have for lunch?

ami: o titi no koko' ko mikaenan no mako.
'ayaw to kiso a tayra, kilim han to ako kiso ano honi.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

ami: Naay, micolo' ho kami to codad.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

ami: caho, mifanaway ho kako to kaysing.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

ami: mifanawan to iso ko kaysing han?
mafanaway to ako ko kaysing no mako.
mana ca kapinanaw kiso to kamay?
english: Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

ami: wa mimaan kiso ano minoky nani pitilidan?
english: What are you going to do after school?

ami: wa mimaan cingra ano minokay nani pitilidan?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

ami: ci Omos kako, awaay i loma' ci Asenay, wa mimaan saw? ano minokay to ci Asenay i, pasowal han to ako cingra.
english: Asenay is not at home. I am Omos. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

ami: mamo, ci Afas aci Asenay kami, patadoen ho kami a mifawah!
english: Grandma, we are Afas and Asenay, please open the door for us.

ami: ci Foya kako, o mamikilim kako ci Ofayan.
english: I am Fuya, I am here for Ofay.

ami: mamo, tayniay kako a miliso' i tisowanan.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

ami: halafinay to kiso a ca katayni, ma'ilolay to kako i tisowanan.
english: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

ami: Asenay, kilimen to ako kiso a misalama.
english: Asenay, I am here to play with you.

ami: kapicomod to, halafinay to ko pitatala ako i tisowanan.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

ami: o nipasinikan no mako koni a konga, tanamen a komaen makena!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

ami: katayni! o nipalomaan no mako a losay koni, tanamen a komaen.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

ami: kamaro'! tanamen a komaen koni nipalomaan ako a ariray!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

ami: waw! tadako^sanay to koni a ariray.
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

ami: cowa kanga'ay kako a komaen to mami', o lingko to ko kaenen no mako.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

ami: cowa kanga'ay kako a komaen to 'asiro, o lingko to ko kaenen no mako.
english: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

ami: kelacen ako ko losay a pakaen i tisowanan.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

ami: Aray, makasalangay to koni a losay.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

ami: alaen ako ko nanom a pananom i tisowanan.
english: I will bring you some water.

ami: halikaenen, adihayay ko mitangtangan ako a dateng.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

ami: halikaenen, adihayay ho ko kakaenen itini.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

ami: ano hatira i, cowa to kangodo kako a komaen yo!
english: I’ll make myself at home then.

ami: halikaenen, adihayay ho ko kakaenen itini.
english: Enjoy yourself.There is a lot more.

ami: adihayay to ko mikaenan no mako, cowa to kanga'ay a komaen.
english: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

ami: keriden no singsi kamo a talatokos anini.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

ami: adihayay ko likes i tokos sanay ci ina.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

ami: keriden no singsi kamo a talaomah anini.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

ami: keriden no singsi kita a tayra i 'alo.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

ami: keriden no singsi kita a talatokos.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

ami: cowa, o kakeriden no singsi kita a talatokos.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
No, we are going to the fields.

ami: singsi, o manan ko nanengnengen no mita a tala'alo?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

ami: singsi, o manan ko nanengnengen no mita a talatokos?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

ami: talaomah kita a minengneng to nipalomaan ita a ariray, iraay ko kakonah 'odal kapina'on to yo!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

ami: singsi, o tatala'alo kita a midangoy han?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

ami: cowa, o maminengneng kita to facacido'.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

ami: singsi, o tatalaomah kita a mipaloma to dateng han?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

ami: iraay ko sa 'efe'efer sanay a facacido' itira.
anini kako a paka'araw to so^linay ma'oripay ho a facacido'.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

ami: iraay ko sa 'efe'efer sanay a 'adipangpang itira.

english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

ami: iraay ko sa 'efe'efer sanay a 'adipangpang itira.

english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

ami: itini to a misanengnengnengneng, aka to katalaraay yo!
english: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

ami: aka to kacomikay, sanga'ayen ko rakat 'arawi a mapoling.
english: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

ami: nanay narikay a ma'araw no mako.
english: I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?

ami: pakamaanay cingra a tayra i paisingan?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

ami: rakat sanay cingra a tayra i paisingan.
pakamaanay kiso a tayra i Pengho?
english: How do you go to Penghu?

ami: pakahikokiay kako a tayra i Pengho.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.

ami: pakamaanay kiso a tayra i Pengho?
english: How do you go to Penghu?

ami: pakataminaay kako a tayra i Pengho.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.
How does Panay go to school?
Panay goes to school by train.
How does Kacaw go to church?
Kacaw goes to church by bicycle.

ami: paka捷運nay kiso a talapitilidan han?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?
No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?
Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

ami: paka高鐵ay kiso a talaTakaw han?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

ami: Hai, paka高鐵ay kako a talaTakaw.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

ami: pakacinamalay anca pakahikokiay kiso a talaPosong han?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

ami: pakahikokiay, pakahikokiay ko kalikiay to pakacinamalay.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

ami: pakapasoay anca pakapalidingay kiso a talakiwkay han?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

ami: pakapalidingay kako a talakiwkay, pakapalidingay ko calowayay to pakapasoay.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

ami: mangataay no patiyamay ko loma' namo han?
english: Is the market close to your house?

ami: cowa kangata, pakaotopayay to kako a tayra i patiyamay.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

ami: mangataay no pitilidan ko yofing han?
english: Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.

ami: mangataay no siyataw ko kakomaenan han?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

ami: masadak nani siyataw maedeng lima a fon ko rarakaten tahira to.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

ami: iraay ko demak no mako awaay i loma' kako anini, liyaw sa to a romi'ad makena?
english: I am out today. How about another day?

ami: cilimaw kiso ano cila haw? herek no lahok tayra kako a mikilim i tisowanan.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

ami: nga'ay to, tala han ako kiso i loma'.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

ami: manga'ay kako a misolot to ngiha iso han? sapikilokan nanay kako.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

ami: hayda! nga'ayay to. awa ko maan.

english: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

ami: cowa kakapah kako, cowa ho kalosimet koni a 'ariri, aka to.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

ami: ano hatira i, sasing han aca ako.
english: Then I will just take photos.

ami: aray han ako kiso to pihai iso to pihomong ako i tisowanan.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

ami: awaay ko maan, o manan ko lalicayen no miso?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

ami: o manan ko midemakan no miso i kakaemangan ho?
english: What do you do when you are young?

ami: o malatayxinay kako i 'ayaw, misawaday to kako no hatini.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

ami: itiniay i niyaro' ko aro' no wawa iso han?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

ami: cowa, itiniay i tokay ko aro' no wawa ako.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

ami: iraay ho ko cecay a waco ato cecay a 'ayam, o paro no loma' ako cangra.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

ami: iraay aca ko cecay a posi, ira ko pipacafay no pinanowang i, caay to kato'ol.
english: I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

ami: milicay kako i tisowanan to pakiniay to paysin no pi'adop hananay.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

ami: cowa kaadihay ko kafana'an ako, ora kafana'an no mako i, haemin han ako a pakafana' i tisowanan.
english: I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

ami: ora sapi'adop namo a sakatayal i, iraay ko maan a paysinan han?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

ami: tati'ihay a papitefingen ko fafahiyan to sapi'adop niyam a sakatayal.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

ami: manga'ay a mitoor ko fafahiyan a mi'adop han?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

ami: cowa, tati'ihay a mi'adop ko fafahiyan.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

ami: Kacaw, awaay to ko epah no loma' 'acaen ho ko epah ito.
english: Kacaw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

ami: iraay ho ko cecay i kofaw, ca to kapi'aca haw!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

ami: cowa kaedeng ko cecay, 'acaen ho ko tosa a minokay.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

ami: mi'aca kako to epah, paliwalay kamo han?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

ami: tosa ko 'a'acaen ako, mi'aca ho kako to cecay lofoc a felac.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

ami: ini ko felac, o manan ho ko 'a'acaen iso?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

ami: mi'aca ho kako to fita'ol, iraay han?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

ami: maeminay to a mapaliwal ko fita'ol.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

ami: o kamoko'ay ko taca^dongan a riko' ko 'a'acaen ako.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

ami: iraay ho ko roma a cengel han?
iraay ho ko kohecalay ato langdaway niyam.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

ami: pafelien kako to cecay langdaway a riko'.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

ami: Kacaw, o talacowaay kiso i honi? miontoay kiso han?
english: Kacaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

ami: cowa, mipadangay kako ci mamoan a mipaliwal to dateng.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

ami: ha, hatiniay han, cilimaw kiso ano dadaya? malacafay i takowanan a malafi makena?
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

ami: cowa kanga'ay, mi'aca kako to riko'.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.

ami: ano hatira i, tooren ako kiso a tayra.
nga'ay ho, pina ko 'aca nona dateng?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

ami: tosa a polo' ko 'aca no dateng to cecay a lolong.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

ami: tolo a polo' ko 'aca no konga to cecay a tingting.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

ami: pafelien kako to tosa lolong a dateng ato cecay tingting a konga.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

ami: Kacaw, matawalay ako a miala ko impic, manga'ay a pacaliwen iso kako han?
english: Kacaw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

ami: awaay ko no mako, o ni Panay koni.
english: I don’t have one either. This is Panay’s.

ami: manga'ay a pacaliwen kako to miming han? kalikien to ako a patikol i tisowanan.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

ami: aray, patadoen to kako a miaray ci Panayan.
english: Thank you and thank Panay for me.

ami: mipatikol kako tona tosa a codad.
english: I want to return these two books.

ami: hay, iraay ho ko roma to aalaen iso?
english: No problem and what else do you need?

ami: micaliw ho kako tona tolo a codad.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

ami: maherek to, haratengen ikor no tolo a romi'ad patikolen to a tayni.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

ami: cowa ho kapatikolen iso kako to sararop.
english: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

ami: mana awa to ko sararop no mako.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

ami: mipacaliwan iso ci Kacaw cowa saw?
english: Did you lend it to Kacaw?

ami: cowa kafana' kako, licayen ako cingra.
english: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

ami: pacaliwen ho ako kiso to no mako a sararop.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

ami: Panay, o mipacaliwan ni Kacaw kisonan koni a ciyampa han?
english: Panay, did Kacaw lend you this coat?

ami: cowa, o mi'acaan ni ina ako to hano mako.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

ami: mahecaday ko ciyampa ni Kacaw to no miso.
english: Kacaw’s coat is the same as yours.

ami: o kohetingay ko no mira a ciyampa, cowa kahecad ko cengel niyam.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

ami: Panay, micaliway kiso to payci i ci Kacawan han?
english: Panay, did you borrow money from Kacaw?

ami: Hai , o papatikolen no mako i cingranan anini nika , matawalay ako a miala ko payci.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

ami: ano hacowa to a patikolen iso saw?
english: Then, when will you return the money?

ami: patikolen to ako i cingranan ano cila.
english: I will return to him tomorrow.

ami: Hayda, pasowal han to ako ci Kacaw.
english: Okay, I will tell Kacaw for you.

ami: Tanofakelohen a micepet ko edo, tanokaereden a micepet ko tikolacay nga' matatodongay.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

ami: Masahatiniay han, mararaway to kako! salaw cowa kapakacepecepet kako.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

ami: Ano hatira haw i, pasifana'en ako kiso to samaanen a misanga' kona tosa a talakal.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

ami: Hayda! tadafangcal! ano hatini haw i, ikor to wapakacepet to kako to 'a'adopen.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

ami: Sa akawang sanay to ko talod no omah, katayra ho kiso i soko a miala to kawkaw, talaomah kita.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

ami: i cowaay a mateli ko kawkaw?
i tatihiay no fakar, ano micomod kiso i soko i, ma'araw to.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

ami: Kapina'on to a miala, 'arawi a madoka'. citalemay ko kawkaw.
english: Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

ami: Aka ripa'en ko talakal no mako.
I cowaay ko talakal no miso?
itiraay i laeno nora kilang ko talakal no mako.
english: My trap is under that tree.

ami: iraay ko kacipinangan no mako itini, mafana'ay kako to i cowaay ko talakal ako.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

ami: o fofo koni, telian niyam i 'alo a mifoting.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

ami: awaay ko fofo no niyam itira, tanopacemotan no niyam ko pifoting.
english: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

ami: cowa ho kapipacemot kako tono pacemot, manga'ay a pasifana'en kako ano cila haw?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

ami: hayda! malacafay kita a mipacemot ano cila.
english: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

ami: pasifana'en ako kiso a misanga' to fofo ano cila.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

ami: tatemikay to ko pacemot no miso, komaenay to ko foting to sapariri' iso alatek! kalikien a mitengteng a patalafekang.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

ami: aka ho, macoyacoyay tato ko tamina. itini kako a mitengteng to pacemot, itira kiso a mipadang i takowanan a miala to salil a patayni.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

ami: pataynien i takowanan a mitengteng ko foting, patadoen no mako kiso a patalafekang.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

ami: tadafangcalay to makadofah ko kinaira ita anini, matomes ko paro no kanas.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

ami: kalikien no mita a minokay a mipalada' to alomanay.
english: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

ami: Aka to pisalama, Kalikien a maro' i 'adengang.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

ami: Sakalima a lipay anini, pahanhan anocila, malacafay kita a misalama!
english: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

ami: Sakatolo a lipay anocila, misalama kita to nanom i helek no lahok anocila!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

ami: Paaliwacan anocila, malacafay kako ci inaan a tayra i kiwkay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

ami: Sakaota'aw sanay kako, tayra ho kako i kamisi'an.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

ami: Hinefa han ho iso a pahanhan.
Singsi, adada ko tiyad ako, tayla ho kako i kamisi'an.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

ami: Manga'ay kako a minanaw to kamay haw?
english: May I go wash my hands?

ami: O mamipahanhan to, honisato a tayra.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

ami: Singsi, adada ko tangal ako, mihifang to helek no lahok.
english: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

ami: Singsi, mihifang kako anocila to sakacecay a lipay, paising ho kako.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

ami: Adada ko tiyad ningra, ira cingra i kamisi'an.
english: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

ami: Singsi, adada ko takolaw ni Kacaw, mihifangay anini.
english: Teacher, Kacaw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

ami: Mana awa ci Panay a tayni saw?
Ci Canglah Kaynga kako, mo^etepay ko mihecaan ako.
english: My name is Canglah Kaynga, and I’m 10 years old.

ami: O maan a kasafinacadan a wawa kiso?
english: What ethnic group are you from?

ami: Saheto o Yincomin ko paro no loma' iso haw?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

ami: Hai, saheto o 'Amis ko paro no loma' niyam.
english: Yes, my whole family is Amis.

ami: Saheto o Yincomin ko paro no loma' iso haw?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

ami: Caayay, o 'Amis ko wama ako, o Payrang ko wina ako.
english: No, my father is Amis, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

ami: Ni Mayaw Lohok a wawa kako.
Ci wama iso kora haw? pina to ko mihecaan ningra?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

ami: Enem polo' to ko mihecaan ningra.
Ci wama iso kora haw? pina to ko mihecaan ningra?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

ami: Caayay, o mato'say niyam cingra i niyaro', falo polo' to ko mihecaan ningra.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

ami: Pina to ko mihecaan no fa'inayan a kaka iso?
Safaw falo to ko mihecaan no fa'inayan a kaka ako.
Hakowaay ko karaaraay no mihecaan namo?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

ami: Lima a mihecaan ko karaaraay niyam.
Cecay so'ot sepat polo' a kongfen ko 'akawang ako.
Halafin to caka saso'araw kita, 'akawangay to kiso?
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

ami: Hai, cecay so'ot tolo polo' a kongfen ko 'akawang ako.
Hai, tolo polo' to ko tingting ako hatini.
Tayra kako i katayalan a mikilim to singsi.
english: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

ami: Ira i pidangoyan cingra, malalifet to pidangoy cingra anohoni.
english: He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

ami: Icowaay ci Panay? malalifet to comikayay cingra anohoni.
english: Where is Panay? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

ami: Ira i riwang cingra, tahidangen ako cingra.
english: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

ami: Miaca ho kako to sakalahok, kilim han to ako kiso anohoni.
english: I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

ami: Mahakelong kita a mililid to tafoan!
english: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

ami: Kilimen iso ko tao, mikilim kako to singsi.
english: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

ami: Malalifetay ci Kacaw to milalayapay a cikay anini haw?
english: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?
No, he’s competing in high jump.
Will you compete in the sports day?
Will you compete in the sports day?

ami: Hai, malalifet kako to milalayapay a cikay.
O mamimaan kita i piondokayan saw?
english: What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

ami: Paliwal kita to kakaenen i piondokayan haw?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

ami: Caayay, o kikoya ko paliwalen no mita.
Pakaala kiso to icifang, ci'icelay to kiso!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

ami: Ira ci mamo i loma' haw?

english: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

ami: Ira ci mamo i loma' haw?
Awaay, masadakay to cingra ihoni, dadaya to nga minokayay.
english: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

ami: Ira ci akong i loma' haw?
Ira cingra i sakatosa a tingroh, kilimen iso cingra i kafekang.
english: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

ami: Ira ko tamdaw i loma' haw?
Ci Kacaw! halafin to caka araw kiso, nga'ayay kiso haw? ?
english: It’s Kacaw. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

ami: Fangcal to! kilimen ako kiso a malaholol.
english: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

ami: Ira cingra i kofaw a misafel, atien ako cingra.
english: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

ami: Tayra cingra i pakoko'an a micapet to koko'.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

ami: Awaay ci akong namo i loma', i omahay cingra, i loma' a mitala kamo cingraan.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

ami: Halafin to caka saso'araw kita, 'akawangay to kiso.
english: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

ami: Mahemek a ma'araw kiso a tayni.
english: It’s so good to see you.

ami: O hano namo koni a talacay, telien i pingsiyang.
english: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

ami: Halafin caka tayni, atien ako cangra a malacafay kita a mitaheka.
english: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

ami: Aka to malifotaw , o ociya ko nanomen ako nga'ay to, i palafangan kita a malaholol.
english: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

ami: Aray to pisitay no miso, minokay to kako.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

ami: I sawniay ho a pacoken koni a koko', panokayen o hakakaenen no miso.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

ami: I dafak helek no lahok ko pitelek kisonan nga'ay to haw?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

ami: Nga'ay to, icowa kita a masaso'araw?
I pitilidan kita nga'ay to haw? misasing kita.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

ami: Itira i sefi ko nga'ay, ciriko' kako to no Pangcah.
english: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

ami: Tada makapahay ko celek no sakola i niyaro' ita. ka fitelekan no hana i, tayni sato a misalama!
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

ami: I ka ilisinan a tayni kiso da!
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

ami: Mana mafolaw kiso a tayni i niyaro'?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

ami: Naw caka i tokay a pasifana'?
english: Why not teach in the city?

ami: Nawhani ma'ilol kako to niyaro', nanay ira ko pipanocay i niyaro'.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

ami: Mafana'ay kiso a mitenoon, cima ko pasifana'ay tisowanan?
english: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

ami: Ci mamo ako, o tada mafana'ay cingra a mitenoon a tamdaw i niyaro' niyam.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

ami: Mana sapi nanamaw kiso a mitenoon?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

ami: O serangawan no mita ko tenoon, sapi parayrayaw kako to serangawan.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

ami: Tada caloway to kiso, halafin ko pieraw haw?
english: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

ami: Caay, cecay a lipay manga'ay to. rahkaden ho ko falinono ato felac, tongalen to otong a mitiyol, ta manga'ay to a telien i koreng.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

ami: O maan ko paliwalan no miso?
Ira ko damdam ato lakiw itini takowanan, saheto no mako a mipalomaan yo!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

ami: Tosa so'ot lima polo' ko polong a pida.
Maolah kako toni a riko', pina ko 'aca nira?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?
It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?
No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

ami: Hayda! cecay a kohetingay ko alaen ako a riko'.
english: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

ami: Alaen ako koni a po'ot ato dangah.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

ami: Tosa patek ko polong a pida, tano kamayan ako a misanga' toni, tada fangcal a cokaymasen.
english: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

ami: Siwkayen ako ko widang tayni a mi'aca, manga'ay a saka^meden haw?
english: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

ami: hayda! keroren ako to falo a 'aca.
english: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

ami: Ati tayni a minengneng! ira ko riko' ato kafong ko mipa'acaan.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

ami: Tolo so'ot lima polo' ko 'aca no cecay a riko', cecay patek ko tolo a riko'.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

ami: Cecay aca ko 'acaen ako, pafelien kako to faelohay.
english: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

ami: Nga'ay ho, sapi 'acaaw kako to hakhak ato mi'imocan a titi.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

ami: Maeminay to ko hemay. ira ho ko tana a yoping ako, 'acaen iso haw?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

ami: Hayda! pafelien kako to cecay, miliyaw to a tayni, ta mi'aca kako to hemay.
english: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

ami: Hai, paroen ako i lofoc, lima polo' a pida konian.
english: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

ami: Ila ko pasowalay a tamdaw sa-"Itira laloma' no pitaongan a sefi' ci Yis! Mitengil to pakafana' no singsi, ato malalicay to sowal no fangcalay a tilid
english: tahila sacangra i pita’ongan a sefi

ami: Ira haca ko roma a katengilan no mako, Oya ngohah no niso i 'a:yaw ci Panay
english: o mamikadafo tayra i Fotod" saan."

ami: I pitoay ko toki tayra to kako i cacodadan.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

ami: Malingato to a micodad! comodsa ko pasevana'ay, sowal sato ko pangcang, "katemireng! micemek!"
english: It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said, “Stand up! Salute!”

ami: Tataang ko nipangiha niyam, "Kapah haw kiso pasevana'ay?"
I nipicodad, pasevana'an no pasevana'ay kami to sasaosian no Pangcah a sowal.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Pangcah language of numbers.

ami: Dodoen niyam ko pasevana'ay a remadiw to sapisa'osi a radiw.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

ami: Adihay to ko nikavana'an no mako to sowal no Pangcah.
english: I have learned many Pangcah languages.

ami: A patengil kako ci inaan to nipinanam to sowal no Pangcah i cacodadan to remiremiad.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Pangcah language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

ami: Ci Kacaw ko ngangan no mako.
Ci Using ko ngangan ni ama no mako.
Ci Panay ko ngangan ni ina no mako.
Moktep to ko mihcaan no mako i anini a mihca.
Sikaka kako to vavainay cacay, ci Kolas han cira, savaw to cacay ko mihcaan nira i anini a mihca.
english: I have a brother, his name is kulas, he is 11 years old.
We study in the same school.
Both my brother and I like to sing.

ami: Maolah kako a midangoy, i pipantangan maroyaroy to ko loma' niyam a midangoy.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

ami: Maolah kako a sicavay to valohay a cavay, malecavay to kami a remadiw, a midangoy.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

ami: I Rinahemay ko loma' no niyam.
U tamdaw no loma' no niyam lalima.
english: There are five people in our family.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

ami: Makomod ko aro' no mako aci ama, ina, ato kaka to vavainayan, kaka to vavahiyan.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

ami: Tarakaw ci ama ako, o malakincalay ci ama no mako.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

ami: Makopit ci ina ako, o ising ci ina no mako.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

ami: Ano i loma' to ci ama, o no Pangcah to ko nikasasowal niyam.
english: My father speaks the Pangcah language with us at home.

ami: I pahanhan no lalodan, taloma' to kami i niyaro'.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

ami: Mahekolong kami a malekaka a milepel to tatakola'.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

ami: Maolah kako to tamdaw no loma' no niyam.
english: I like our family very much.

ami: Tahkal a miholol kako aci ina i anini a remiad.
english: I went out with my mother today.

ami: Salangdaw sa ko kakarayan i remiadan, carangcang aca ko remiad.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

ami: Maro' kami a kemaen to pan i sirengosay a seraan, sadiheko saan ko tireng a mapacidal
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

ami: Salahengan sato ko kakarayan i herek no kalahokan.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

ami: Palitaen no mako ci ina, kiya o lahngangay saw ko kolit no kakarayan?
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

ami: Sowal sato ci ina, kay a inito ko valiyos.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

ami: Awaay ko kotem i lavii, sadak sato ko vois.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

ami: I vatad to sakataloma' a lalanan, milongoc kako to vois.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

ami: Akaa katayni ko valiyos nasa kako, a managlay hen kako a miholol kiyami.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

ami: I tapiingan no loma' ko cacodadan niyam, rakaten no mako a talacacodadan, rakaten aca a taloma' to remiremiad.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

ami: Caay katataang ko cacodadan no niyam, caay kaaloman ko micodaday, o masasovana' to amin kami.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

ami: Malecapo amin ko adiwawa i kavekacan a mimali, a masasowasowal.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

ami: Mikihatiya ko pasevana'ay i tamiyan a mahekolong a maleholol, matiya sa o malecacayay a loma'an ko cacodadan.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

ami: Miasik kami to remiremiad, satamelac han niyam ko nipiasik to picodadan.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

ami: Simisipoay to sasingaran, simiasikay no romaan a tamdaw.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

ami: Miasik aca kami to karimocomocoan no cacodadan, matatahic kami a malalikel a demak, satamelac sato ko cacodadan to remiremiad.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

ami: Natayra kako i niyaro' a miliso' ci vakian i nacila.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

ami: Matenesay to kami a caay kasasoaraw, maoron to kako i ciraan.
english: We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

ami: Melaw saan ci vaki i takowan, pakaenan kako to ciyak, pananoman aca kako to ociya.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

ami: Sicedam to nipalomaan ni vaki to ciyak, saaleso' sa a kaenen.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

ami: U maolahay:to kako to ociya ni vaki, aleso' aca a nananoman.
english: I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

ami: Misakalahok kako aci vayi ako i kalahokan.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

ami: Adihay ko nicacakan ni vayi to sakalahok, sivoting, siayam, sitamorak ato kacomoli.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

ami: Herek sa namalahok, tayra kami i padatengan a mikitoc to dateng.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

ami: Adihay ko nipaahen ni vayi to vonga, tali ato lokiyo i takowan, o sapataloma' no mako saan.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

ami: A miliyas hen kako to henian, romaaw to aca a miliso' i to henian.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

ami: Hakolongen no pasevana'ay kami anini a remiad a tayra i tongoyen, misilsil kami i panan a micakay to paya.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

ami: Comod sa hen kami i tongoyen, sowal sato ko pasevana'ay : i aayaway o ayam, o oner ko i lalikolay, ka amo hanto ko misamelamelaway.
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

ami: U matalaway kako to oner, sisa ,caay pimelaw kako to oner.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

ami: Adihay ko nikamelawan no mako to ayam, simarevahoyay i kodol no kilang, ira aca ko nikamelawan i vohang no kilang simaredavo'ay no tool.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

ami: Ira ko tasiyang, sevayo, lokedaw, i tongoyen, nahacowa kako a makamelaw to matiniay a aadopen, salipahak sa ko voloco' a makamelaw i anini a remiad.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

ami: Adihay ko nipisasing no mako, o sapamelaw ci amaan aci inaan.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

ami: Anoroma, a mahakolong a tayni aca aci ama ato ina.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

ami: A tayra kako i Taytong a miliso' ci vikiyan ako ato kaka to vavahiyan i tina pihivangan a remiadan.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

ami: Namaka Taypak kami a midakaw to silamalay a tayra i Taytong.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

ami: Tangasato i Taytong, parakat ci vaki to karireng a tayni i pangiroan a militemoh i tamiyan.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

ami: I ngata no pangiroan ko loma' ni vaki, caay katenes tangasa to i loma'.
english: The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

ami: Sidadahalay a pahotinan ci vaki i ngata no loma', mahakolongay kami a mivatikar i pahotinan.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

ami: I pahotinan, hakolongen ni vaki kami a tayra a pahavay to siri ato midakaw to sevayo i pahotinan.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

ami: I lavii, mahakolong kami a tayra i patiyamay a malavi.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

ami: Adihay ko karireng i tokay, manay makaotovay kami a tayra i itila.
